Appendix

\parttoc

F Additional Related Works

We review related work from multiple kinds of literature, including incentive exploration and its application in adaptive clinical trails, bandit algorithms, and information design.

F.1 Incentivized exploration

There is a growing literature about a three-way interplay of exploration, exploitation, and incentives, comprising a variety of scenarios. The study of mechanisms to incentivized exploration has been initiated by [52] of the setting of one planner and multiple self-interested agents. They mainly focus on deriving the Bayesian-optimal policy for the case of only two actions and deterministic rewards and only obtain a preliminary result for stochastic rewards. [69] consider a similar two-actions model with time-discounted. If expected rewards are known for one arm, they provide a BIC algorithm that achieves the “first-best” utility. For the general case, they design an optimal BIC algorithm that is computationally inefficient and propose a tractable heuristic based on the same techniques. Similarly, [20] proposes a model with a continuous information flow and a continuum of consumers arriving to a recommendation system and derive a BIC policy restricted to two arms and binary rewards. [30] considers a different setting with monetary transfers, where the platform not only recommends an action to each agent, but also offers a payment for taking this action where in this setting, incentives are created via the offered payments rather than via information asymmetry.

Exploration-exploitation problems with multiple self-interested agents have also been studied in several other scenarios: multiple agents engaging in exploration and benefiting from exploration performed by others, without a planner to coordinate them (e.g., [18, 49]), dynamic pricing with model uncertainty (e.g., [50, 17, 11]), dynamic auctions (e.g., [16, 6, 47, 68, 36]), pay-per-click ad auctions with unknown click probabilities (e.g., [27, 9, 10]), as well as human computation (e.g., [34, 80, 42]).

F.2 Application in medical trails

Patients’ incentives are a significant barrier to conducting medical trials, especially large-scale ones for common conditions with affordable treatments. While recruiting patients and offering treatments is feasible, motivating enough participants to join remains difficult. BIC exploration represents a theoretical effort to overcome this challenge.

Medical trials initially motivated the study of multi-arm bandits (MABs) and exploration-exploitation tradeoffs [84, 35, 86], focusing on designs that consider patient well-being, unlike traditional randomized clinical trials. Bandit-like designs are part of adaptive medical trials [14, 24, 86], which may also feature adaptations like early stopping, re-estimating sample size, and dosage adjustments. Later developments in “message-restricted” algorithms, which do not reveal information to patients, also suit this domain. However, disclosing some information about the medical trial is necessary to meet the “informed consent” standards set by various guidelines and regulations [5]. In addition, medical trials, particularly those involving multiple treatments, underscore the relevance of BIC bandit exploration with multiple actions. Traditional trials typically compare a new treatment against a placebo or standard treatment, but the designs incorporating multiple treatments are gaining practical importance and have been explored in biostatistics literature [41, 32]. It’s important to note that even the expected reward for placebos or standard treatments can be uncertain, as it might vary with the patient population.

BIC bandit exploration with contextual consideration is increasingly applied in adaptive trial designs, leveraging patients’ "background information" to tailor treatments. This contextual data can encompass age, fitness levels, race or ethnicity, medical history, and genetic markers, which are particularly relevant as genetic sequencing becomes more accessible. Personalized medicine, especially treatments dependent on genetic markers in oncology [63, 85, 44]), has been a significant trend over the past decade. Context-dependent medical trials, which are more complex due to the need to consider individual patient contexts, have led to novel and cost-effective trial designs. These designs explicitly use contextual information to determine the best treatment approach for each patient [72, 91], with recent advancements in biostatistics [31, 46, 33, 44] further enhancing these contextual models.

F.3 Bandit algorithms

There are various strategies and algorithms to solve the sequential decision making problem [19, 81, 62, 55], such as the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-greedy algorithm [8, 22, 23, 37, 78], explore-then-commit algorithm [73, 1, 60], upper confidence bound (UCB) algorithms [54, 7, 59, 88], Thompson sampling [84, 74, 75, 61], boostrap sampling algorithm [53, 87, 92, 70], information directed sampling methods [74, 39, 38], inversely proportional to the gap sampling method [3, 29, 79], and betting methods [90, 57]. These algorithms employ different trade-offs between exploration and exploitation to achieve optimal or near-optimal rewards over time.

F.4 Information design

The original Bayesian persuasion framework as introduced by [48], focusing on a single round where the planner’s signal is informed by the "history" of previous interactions. In exploring strategic information disclosure, [71] investigate how planners can encourage better decision-making among agents by controlling information flows. The temporal aspect of information release is addressed by [28, 43], who study the optimization of suspense and the commercial strategy of selling information over time, respectively. These contributions highlight different facets of information design. Additionally, [15, 83] offer extensive insights into the theoretical foundations of designing information structures, which underpin the broader context of our study in information design.

G DBIC Property

G.1 Proof of Theorem 1 - Cold Start Stage

Proof.

To guarantee the DBIC property for the cold start of RCB, it suffices to have a lower bound on parameter L𝐿Litalic_L to avoid too many samples wasted in the cold start stage.

The cold start stage can be split into K𝐾Kitalic_K phases and each phase last L⁢𝖭𝐿𝖭L\mathsf{N}italic_L sansserif_N round in expectation based on the algorithm design except the most popular arm. Although the first phase (most popular arm) last unknown rounds, it usually lasts a pretty short period. So in the following analysis, we ignore the DBIC property in the initial sample collection stage (MPASC stage).

Due to the design of cold start stage, agents are unaware which phase they belong to, they are only aware they have 1/L1𝐿1/L1 / italic_L probability to be chosen in the cold start stage. We first argue that for each agent ptsubscript𝑝𝑡p_{t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in phase l∈[2,K]𝑙2𝐾l\in[2,K]italic_l ∈ [ 2 , italic_K ] (except the MPASC), she has no incentive not to follow the recommended arm.

(1). If agent ptsubscript𝑝𝑡p_{t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is recommended with the arm j≠a~t𝑗subscript~𝑎𝑡j\neq\widetilde{a}_{t}italic_j ≠ over~ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then she knows since this arm j𝑗jitalic_j is the organic arm at∗superscriptsubscript𝑎𝑡a_{t}^{*}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and is not the promoted arm; so by the definition of the organic arm, it is DBIC for the agent to follow it.

(2). If agent ptsubscript𝑝𝑡p_{t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is recommended with the arm a~tsubscript~𝑎𝑡\widetilde{a}_{t}over~ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and does not want to deviate to some other arms j≠a~t𝑗subscript~𝑎𝑡j\neq\widetilde{a}_{t}italic_j ≠ over~ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. That is to say, we need to prove that when the platform recommend arm i𝑖iitalic_i, the agent ptsubscript𝑝𝑡p_{t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has no incentive to deviate the current recommendation arm i𝑖iitalic_i to other arm j𝑗jitalic_j in expected reward. From the user’s perspective, the platform needs to demonstrate this,

𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|It=i]⁢Pr⁢(It=i)≥0.𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖Prsubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖0\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|I_{t}=i]\text{Pr}(I_{t}=i)% \geq 0.blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] Pr ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ) ≥ 0 . (G.1)

Denote the time dependent posterior gap Gt⁢i⁢j:=𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|SBt]assignsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝑆subscript𝐵𝑡G_{tij}:=\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|S_{B_{t}}]italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] where arm i𝑖iitalic_i is the recommended arm by RCB and j≠i𝑗𝑖j\neq iitalic_j ≠ italic_i, and the corresponding minimal posterior gap Gt⁢(i)=minj≠i⁡Gt⁢i⁢jsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖subscript𝑗𝑖subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗G_{t}(i)=\min_{j\neq i}G_{tij}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j ≠ italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The Gt⁢i⁢jsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗G_{tij}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represents the posterior gap between arm i𝑖iitalic_i and arm j𝑗jitalic_j at time t𝑡titalic_t. The Gt⁢(i)subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖G_{t}(i)italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) represents the minimal gap given the current accumulative samples which is composed of two cases: (1) Gt⁢(i)>0subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0G_{t}(i)>0italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0, that means arm i𝑖iitalic_i is the posterior best arm. (2) Gt⁢(i)≤0subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0G_{t}(i)\leq 0italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0, that means arm i𝑖iitalic_i is not the posterior best arm.

To satisfy the ϵ−DBICitalic-ϵDBIC\epsilon-\text{DBIC}italic_ϵ - DBIC property, we need the Eq. (G.1) satisfied. By the law of iterated expectations E⁢[X]=E⁢[E⁢[X|Y]]𝐸delimited-[]𝑋𝐸delimited-[]𝐸delimited-[]conditional𝑋𝑌E[X]=E[E[X|Y]]italic_E [ italic_X ] = italic_E [ italic_E [ italic_X | italic_Y ] ], we have

𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|It=i]⁢Pr⁢(It=i)𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖Prsubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|I_{t}=i]\text{Pr}(I_{t}=i)blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] Pr ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ) (G.2)
=𝔼⁢[𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|SBt]|It=i]⁢Pr⁢(It=i)absent𝔼delimited-[]conditional𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝑆subscript𝐵𝑡subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖Prsubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}[\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|S_{B_{t}}]|I_{t}% =i]\text{Pr}(I_{t}=i)= blackboard_E [ blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] Pr ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i )
=𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j|It=i]⁢Pr⁢(It=i)>−ϵ.absent𝔼delimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖Prsubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖italic-ϵ\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|I_{t}=i]\text{Pr}(I_{t}=i)>-\epsilon.= blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] Pr ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ) > - italic_ϵ .

Define two events Qt,1={qt=1}subscript𝑄𝑡1subscript𝑞𝑡1Q_{t,1}=\{q_{t}=1\}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 } and Qt,0={qt=0}subscript𝑄𝑡0subscript𝑞𝑡0Q_{t,0}=\{q_{t}=0\}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 }, representing agent ptsubscript𝑝𝑡p_{t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is recommended with the promoted arm or organic arm respectively. Thus, there are two disjoint events under which agent ptsubscript𝑝𝑡p_{t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is recommended arm i𝑖iitalic_i, either Et⁢1={Gt⁢(i)>0}subscript𝐸𝑡1subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0E_{t1}=\{G_{t}(i)>0\}italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 } or Et⁢2={Gt⁢(i)≤0}={Gt⁢(i)≤0⁢ and ⁢pt∈Qt,1}subscript𝐸𝑡2subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0 and subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝑄𝑡1E_{t2}=\{G_{t}(i)\leq 0\}=\{G_{t}(i)\leq 0\text{ and }p_{t}\in Q_{t,1}\}italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 } = { italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 and italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. For notation simplicity, we denote E1=Et⁢1subscript𝐸1subscript𝐸𝑡1E_{1}=E_{t1}italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and E2=Et⁢2subscript𝐸2subscript𝐸𝑡2E_{2}=E_{t2}italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The reason {Gt⁢(i)≤0}={Gt⁢(i)≤0⁢ and ⁢pt∈Qt,1}subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0 and subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝑄𝑡1\{G_{t}(i)\leq 0\}=\{G_{t}(i)\leq 0\text{ and }p_{t}\in Q_{t,1}\}{ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 } = { italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 and italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is because Gt⁢(i)≤0subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0G_{t}(i)\leq 0italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 happens only when pt∈Qt,1subscript𝑝𝑡subscript𝑄𝑡1p_{t}\in Q_{t,1}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. So the above equation is equivalent to prove

𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j|Ipt=i]⁢Pr⁢(It=i)=𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j|E1]⁢Pr⁢(E1)+𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j|E2]⁢Pr⁢(E2)>0.𝔼delimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗subscript𝐼subscript𝑝𝑡𝑖Prsubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖𝔼delimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗subscript𝐸1Prsubscript𝐸1𝔼delimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗subscript𝐸2Prsubscript𝐸20\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|I_{p_{t}}=i]\text{Pr}(I_{t}=i)=\mathbb{E}[G_{% tij}|E_{1}]\text{Pr}(E_{1})+\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|E_{2}]\text{Pr}(E_{2})>0.blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] Pr ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ) = blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] Pr ( italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] Pr ( italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) > 0 . (G.3)

We observe that Pr⁢(E2)=Pr⁢(pt∈Qt,1|Gt⁢(i)≤0)⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)≤0)=Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)≤0)/LtPrsubscript𝐸2Prsubscript𝑝𝑡conditionalsubscript𝑄𝑡1subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0subscript𝐿𝑡\text{Pr}(E_{2})=\text{Pr}(p_{t}\in Q_{t,1}|G_{t}(i)\leq 0)\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)% \leq 0)=\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)\leq 0)/L_{t}Pr ( italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = Pr ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 ) Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 ) = Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 ) / italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, where qt∼Ber⁢(1/Lt)similar-tosubscript𝑞𝑡Ber1subscript𝐿𝑡q_{t}\sim\text{Ber}(1/L_{t})italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ Ber ( 1 / italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and is time dependent and independent of other random variables. Since the event pt∈Qsubscript𝑝𝑡𝑄p_{t}\in Qitalic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ italic_Q is independent of Gt⁢i⁢jsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗G_{tij}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and agent ptsubscript𝑝𝑡p_{t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in Qt,1subscript𝑄𝑡1Q_{t,1}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is randomly selected according to the Bernoulli distribution with expectation 1/Lt1subscript𝐿𝑡1/L_{t}1 / italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Therefore, we get:

𝔼𝔼\displaystyle\mathbb{E}blackboard_E [μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|It=i]⁢Pr⁢(It=i)delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖Prsubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖\displaystyle[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|I_{t}=i]\text{Pr}(I_{t}=i)[ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] Pr ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ) (G.4)

=𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)>0)+1Lt⁢𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j|Gt⁢(i)≤0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)≤0),absent𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖01subscript𝐿𝑡𝔼delimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|G_{t}(i)>0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)>0)+\frac{1}{L_{% t}}\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|G_{t}(i)\leq 0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)\leq 0),= blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ) + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 ) ,

where the second equation holds by the independent property. By the fact that 𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j]=𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j|Gt⁢(i)≤0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)≤0)+𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)>0)𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗𝔼delimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}]=\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|G_{t}(i)\leq 0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)\leq 0% )+\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|G_{t}(i)>0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)>0)blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0 ) + blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ), so the above equation becomes

=𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)>0)+1Lt⁢(𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j]−𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)>0))absent𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖01subscript𝐿𝑡𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|G_{t}(i)>0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)>0)+\frac{1}{L_{% t}}\bigg{(}\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}]-\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|G_{t}(i)>0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i% )>0)\bigg{)}= blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ) + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] - blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ) ) (G.5)
=(1−1Lt)⁢𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)>0)+1Lt⁢𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j].absent11subscript𝐿𝑡𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖01subscript𝐿𝑡𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗\displaystyle=(1-\frac{1}{L_{t}})\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|G_{t}(i)>0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}% (i)>0)+\frac{1}{L_{t}}\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}].= ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ) + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] .

We know 𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j]=𝔼⁢[𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|SBt]]=𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)]=xt𝖳⁢βi,0−xt𝖳⁢βj,0=μ0⁢(t,i)−μ0⁢(t,j)𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗𝔼delimited-[]𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝑆subscript𝐵𝑡𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝖳subscript𝛽𝑖0superscriptsubscript𝑥𝑡𝖳subscript𝛽𝑗0subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑖subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑗\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}]=\mathbb{E}[\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|S_{B_{t}}]% ]=\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)]=x_{t}^{\sf T}\beta_{i,0}-x_{t}^{\sf T}% \beta_{j,0}=\mu_{0}(t,i)-\mu_{0}(t,j)blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = blackboard_E [ blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ] = blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) ] = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sansserif_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sansserif_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_i ) - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_j ). Thus, the above equation will be

=(1−1Lt)⁢𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)>0)+1Lt⁢(μ0⁢(t,i)−μ0⁢(t,j)).absent11subscript𝐿𝑡𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖01subscript𝐿𝑡subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑖subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑗=(1-\frac{1}{L_{t}})\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|G_{t}(i)>0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)>0)+\frac{% 1}{L_{t}}(\mu_{0}(t,i)-\mu_{0}(t,j)).= ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ) + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_i ) - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_j ) ) . (G.6)

To make the process be ϵ−DBICitalic-ϵDBIC\epsilon-\text{DBIC}italic_ϵ - DBIC, we need 𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|It=i]⁢Pr⁢(It=i)>−ϵ𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖Prsubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖italic-ϵ\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|I_{t}=i]\text{Pr}(I_{t}=i)>-\epsilonblackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] Pr ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ) > - italic_ϵ. Since we know Gt⁢i⁢j>Gt⁢(i)subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖G_{tij}>G_{t}(i)italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) by definition, so we have 𝔼⁢[Gt⁢i⁢j⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]>𝔼⁢[Gt⁢(i)⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0\mathbb{E}[G_{tij}|G_{t}(i)>0]>\mathbb{E}[G_{t}(i)|G_{t}(i)>0]blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] > blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ]. To combine them all, we get

≥(1−1Lt)⁢𝔼⁢[Gt⁢(i)⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)>0)+1Lt⁢(μ0⁢(t,i)−μ0⁢(t,j))≥−ϵ.absent11subscript𝐿𝑡𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖01subscript𝐿𝑡subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑖subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑗italic-ϵ\displaystyle\geq(1-\frac{1}{L_{t}})\mathbb{E}[G_{t}(i)|G_{t}(i)>0]\text{Pr}(G% _{t}(i)>0)+\frac{1}{L_{t}}(\mu_{0}(t,i)-\mu_{0}(t,j))\geq-\epsilon.≥ ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ) + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_i ) - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_j ) ) ≥ - italic_ϵ . (G.7)

Thus, ∀i,j∈[K]for-all𝑖𝑗delimited-[]𝐾\forall i,j\in[K]∀ italic_i , italic_j ∈ [ italic_K ], it suffices to pick Ltsubscript𝐿𝑡L_{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at time t𝑡titalic_t such that:

=1+μ0⁢(t,j)−μ0⁢(t,i)−ϵ𝔼⁢[Gt⁢(i)⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)>0)+ϵ,absent1subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑗subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑖italic-ϵ𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0italic-ϵ\displaystyle=1+\frac{\mu_{0}(t,j)-\mu_{0}(t,i)-\epsilon}{\mathbb{E}[G_{t}(i)|% G_{t}(i)>0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)>0)+\epsilon},= 1 + divide start_ARG italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_j ) - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_i ) - italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ) + italic_ϵ end_ARG ,

Thus we need,

Lt≥1+Δ¯t0−ϵτ𝒫0,t⁢ρ𝒫0,t+ϵ,subscript𝐿𝑡1subscriptsuperscript¯Δ0𝑡italic-ϵsubscript𝜏subscript𝒫0𝑡subscript𝜌subscript𝒫0𝑡italic-ϵ\displaystyle L_{t}\geq 1+\frac{\overline{\Delta}^{0}_{t}-\epsilon}{\tau_{% \mathcal{P}_{0,t}}\rho_{\mathcal{P}_{0,t}}+\epsilon},italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ 1 + divide start_ARG over¯ start_ARG roman_Δ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_ϵ end_ARG , (G.9)

where Δ¯t0=maxi≠j⁡[μ0⁢(t,j)−μ0⁢(t,i)]subscriptsuperscript¯Δ0𝑡subscript𝑖𝑗subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑗subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑖\overline{\Delta}^{0}_{t}=\max_{i\neq j}[\mu_{0}(t,j)-\mu_{0}(t,i)]over¯ start_ARG roman_Δ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ≠ italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_j ) - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_i ) ], and 𝔼⁢[Gt⁢(i)⁢|Gt⁢(i)>⁢0]⁢Pr⁢(Gt⁢(i)>0)≥τ𝒫0,t⁢ρ𝒫0,t𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖ketsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0Prsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0subscript𝜏subscript𝒫0𝑡subscript𝜌subscript𝒫0𝑡\mathbb{E}[G_{t}(i)|G_{t}(i)>0]\text{Pr}(G_{t}(i)>0)\geq\tau_{\mathcal{P}_{0,t% }}\rho_{\mathcal{P}_{0,t}}blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) | italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ] Pr ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0 ) ≥ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

By the design of the cold start stage, we know that arm i𝑖iitalic_i is the platform recommended arm and arm j𝑗jitalic_j is the arm agent ptsubscript𝑝𝑡p_{t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT potentially wants to deviate to. Therefore, based on the prior knwoledge, μ0⁢(t,j)≥μ0⁢(t,i)subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑗subscript𝜇0𝑡𝑖\mu_{0}(t,j)\geq\mu_{0}(t,i)italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_j ) ≥ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t , italic_i ). Since this Ltsubscript𝐿𝑡L_{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is time dependent, to get a time uniform L𝐿Litalic_L to let all agents have the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC property, we need

maxt⁡Lt=1+Δ¯0−ϵτ𝒫0⁢ρ𝒫0+ϵ,subscript𝑡subscript𝐿𝑡1superscript¯Δ0italic-ϵsubscript𝜏subscript𝒫0subscript𝜌subscript𝒫0italic-ϵ\displaystyle\max_{t}L_{t}=1+\frac{\overline{\Delta}^{0}-\epsilon}{\tau_{% \mathcal{P}_{0}}\rho_{\mathcal{P}_{0}}+\epsilon},roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 + divide start_ARG over¯ start_ARG roman_Δ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_ϵ end_ARG , (G.10)

where Δ¯0=maxt⁡Δ¯t0superscript¯Δ0subscript𝑡subscriptsuperscript¯Δ0𝑡\overline{\Delta}^{0}=\max_{t}\overline{\Delta}^{0}_{t}over¯ start_ARG roman_Δ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over¯ start_ARG roman_Δ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and we know Δ¯0≤1superscript¯Δ01\overline{\Delta}^{0}\leq 1over¯ start_ARG roman_Δ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ 1, and τ𝒫0=mint⁡τ𝒫0,tsubscript𝜏subscript𝒫0subscript𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝒫0𝑡\tau_{\mathcal{P}_{0}}=\min_{t}\tau_{\mathcal{P}_{0,t}}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ρ𝒫0=mint⁡ρ𝒫0,tsubscript𝜌subscript𝒫0subscript𝑡subscript𝜌subscript𝒫0𝑡\rho_{\mathcal{P}_{0}}=\min_{t}\rho_{\mathcal{P}_{0,t}}italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 , italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. So we have L𝐿Litalic_L needs to be at least

L≥1+1−ϵτ𝒫0⁢ρ𝒫0+ϵ.𝐿11italic-ϵsubscript𝜏subscript𝒫0subscript𝜌subscript𝒫0italic-ϵ\displaystyle L\geq 1+\frac{1-\epsilon}{\tau_{\mathcal{P}_{0}}\rho_{\mathcal{P% }_{0}}+\epsilon}.italic_L ≥ 1 + divide start_ARG 1 - italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_ϵ end_ARG . (G.11)

By selecting the time uniform L𝐿Litalic_L, we have the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC property.

∎

G.2 Proof of Theorem 1 - Exploitation Stage

Proof.

To satisfy the DBIC property, which is any agent ptsubscript𝑝𝑡p_{t}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT who is recommended arm i𝑖iitalic_i (It=isubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖I_{t}=iitalic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i) does not to want to switch to some other arm j𝑗jitalic_j in expectation. Besides, we assert that when the platform satisfies the DBIC property at the cold start stage and the DBIC property also holds when we have a minimum requirement of 𝖭𝖭\mathsf{N}sansserif_N, then in the following epochs, the RCB algorithm will automatically satisfy the DBIC in the exploitation stage. More formally, we need that

𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|It=i]⁢Pr⁢(It=i)≥−ϵ/K,∀t∈exploitation stage.formulae-sequence𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖Prsubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖italic-ϵ𝐾for-all𝑡exploitation stage.\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|I_{t}=i]\text{Pr}(I_{t}=i)% \geq-\epsilon/K,\forall t\in\text{exploitation stage.}blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] Pr ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ) ≥ - italic_ϵ / italic_K , ∀ italic_t ∈ exploitation stage. (G.12)

Similarly to the construction of L𝐿Litalic_L in the previous analysis, we denote the time dependent posterior gap Gt⁢i⁢j:=𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|S∗]assignsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝑆G_{tij}:=\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|S_{*}]italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] where arm i𝑖iitalic_i is the recommended arm by RCB and j≠i𝑗𝑖j\neq iitalic_j ≠ italic_i, where S∗subscript𝑆S_{*}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the dataset collected in the the cold start stage. The corresponding minimal posterior gap Gt⁢(i)=minj≠i⁡Gt⁢i⁢jsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖subscript𝑗𝑖subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗G_{t}(i)=\min_{j\neq i}G_{tij}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j ≠ italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The Gt⁢i⁢jsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖𝑗G_{tij}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represents the posterior gap between arm i𝑖iitalic_i and arm j𝑗jitalic_j at time t𝑡titalic_t. The Gt⁢(i)subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖G_{t}(i)italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) represents the minimal gap given the current accumulative samples which is composed of two cases: (1) If Gt⁢(i)>0subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0G_{t}(i)>0italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) > 0, that means arm i𝑖iitalic_i is the best arm in terms of the posterior. (2) If Gt⁢(i)≤0subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖0G_{t}(i)\leq 0italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ≤ 0, that means arm i𝑖iitalic_i is not the posterior best arm. Recall the definition of Gt⁢(i)subscript𝐺𝑡𝑖G_{t}(i)italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ), it suffices to show that

𝔼⁢[Gt⁢(i)|It=i]𝔼delimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝐺𝑡𝑖subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[G_{t}(i)|I_{t}=i]blackboard_E [ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] =𝔼⁢[𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−maxj∈[K]/i⁡μ⁢(xt,j)|S∗]|It=i]absent𝔼delimited-[]conditional𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditionalsubscript𝑗delimited-[]𝐾𝑖𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝑆subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}\bigg{[}\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\max_{j\in[K]/i}\mu(x_% {t},j)|S_{*}]|I_{t}=i\bigg{]}= blackboard_E [ blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j ∈ [ italic_K ] / italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] (G.13)

Part I Reward Gap:

Part I Reward Gap≥1K⁢Gt⁢(bt).Part I Reward Gap1𝐾subscript𝐺𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡\displaystyle\text{Part I Reward Gap}\geq\frac{1}{K}G_{t}(b_{t}).Part I Reward Gap ≥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (G.15)
Part II Reward Gap:

According to the sampling structure, it has the probability that the platform recommended arm is not btsubscript𝑏𝑡b_{t}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have

=\displaystyle== ∑i≠btpt⁢(i)⁢[𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)|S∗]−𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,bt)|S∗]]subscript𝑖subscript𝑏𝑡subscript𝑝𝑡𝑖delimited-[]𝔼delimited-[]conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖subscript𝑆𝔼delimited-[]conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript𝑆\displaystyle\sum_{i\neq b_{t}}p_{t}(i)\bigg{[}\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)|S_{*}]-% \mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},b_{t})|S_{*}]\bigg{]}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ≠ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) [ blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] - blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ]
=\displaystyle== −∑i≠btpt⁢(i)⁢[𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,bt)|S∗]−𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)|S∗]]subscript𝑖subscript𝑏𝑡subscript𝑝𝑡𝑖delimited-[]𝔼delimited-[]conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript𝑆𝔼delimited-[]conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖subscript𝑆\displaystyle-\sum_{i\neq b_{t}}p_{t}(i)\bigg{[}\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},b_{t})|S_% {*}]-\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)|S_{*}]\bigg{]}- ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ≠ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) [ blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] - blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ]
=\displaystyle== −rtsubscript𝑟𝑡\displaystyle-r_{t}- italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

where rt=∑i≠btpt⁢(i)⁢(𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,bt)|S∗]−𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)|S∗])subscript𝑟𝑡subscript𝑖subscript𝑏𝑡subscript𝑝𝑡𝑖𝔼delimited-[]conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript𝑆𝔼delimited-[]conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖subscript𝑆r_{t}=\sum_{i\neq b_{t}}p_{t}(i)(\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},b_{t})|S_{*}]-\mathbb{E}% [\mu(x_{t},i)|S_{*}])italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ≠ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) ( blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] - blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ). Therefore, to achieve DBIC property, we can lower bound the following term,

𝔼⁢[μ⁢(xt,i)−μ⁢(xt,j)|It=i]⁢Pr⁢(It=i)≥Gt⁢(bt)K−rt≥Gt⁢(bt)K−Kγm𝔼delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝑗subscript𝐼𝑡𝑖Prsubscript𝐼𝑡𝑖subscript𝐺𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡𝐾subscript𝑟𝑡subscript𝐺𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡𝐾𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\mu(x_{t},i)-\mu(x_{t},j)|I_{t}=i]\text{Pr}(I_{t}=i)% \geq\frac{G_{t}(b_{t})}{K}-r_{t}\geq\frac{G_{t}(b_{t})}{K}-\frac{K}{\gamma_{m}}blackboard_E [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ) | italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ] Pr ( italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i ) ≥ divide start_ARG italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG - italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ divide start_ARG italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG - divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG (G.17)

The Gt⁢(bt)/Ksubscript𝐺𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡𝐾G_{t}(b_{t})/Kitalic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) / italic_K is each step’s expected gain and rtsubscript𝑟𝑡r_{t}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is each step’s expected loss, and by Lemma 7, we have rt≤K/γmsubscript𝑟𝑡𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚r_{t}\leq K/\gamma_{m}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_K / italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT used in the last inequality. In order to satisfy the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC property, we need

Gt⁢(bt)K−Kγm>−ϵKsubscript𝐺𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡𝐾𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚italic-ϵ𝐾\displaystyle\frac{G_{t}(b_{t})}{K}-\frac{K}{\gamma_{m}}>-\frac{\epsilon}{K}divide start_ARG italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG - divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG > - divide start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG (G.18)

which is equivalent to need

γm⁢(ϵ)≥K2Gt⁢(bt)+ϵ.subscript𝛾𝑚italic-ϵsuperscript𝐾2subscript𝐺𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡italic-ϵ\gamma_{m}(\epsilon)\geq\frac{K^{2}}{G_{t}(b_{t})+\epsilon}.italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ϵ ) ≥ divide start_ARG italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_ϵ end_ARG . (G.19)

That is, in order to satisfy the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC property, we need the spread parameter at each epoch m(≥m0)annotated𝑚absentsubscript𝑚0m(\geq m_{0})italic_m ( ≥ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is at least greater than γm⁢(ϵ)subscript𝛾𝑚italic-ϵ\gamma_{m}(\epsilon)italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ϵ ). Here τm=2msubscript𝜏𝑚superscript2𝑚\tau_{m}=2^{m}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the time step where epoch m𝑚mitalic_m stops. ℰℱ,δ⁢(m−1)subscriptℰℱ𝛿𝑚1\mathcal{E}_{\mathcal{F},\delta}(m-1)caligraphic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F , italic_δ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_m - 1 ) represents the prediction error in the functional class ℱℱ\mathcal{F}caligraphic_F when using training data collected in epoch m−1𝑚1m-1italic_m - 1 that is in the time interval (τm−2,τm−1]subscript𝜏𝑚2subscript𝜏𝑚1(\tau_{m-2},\tau_{m-1}]( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Based on the offline learning’s result from Definition 2 given the epoch m𝑚mitalic_m, we have γm0=c⁢K/ℰℱ,δ⁢(τm0−1−τm0−2)subscript𝛾subscript𝑚0𝑐𝐾subscriptℰℱ𝛿subscript𝜏subscript𝑚01subscript𝜏subscript𝑚02\gamma_{m_{0}}=c\sqrt{K/\mathcal{E}_{\mathcal{F},\delta}(\tau_{m_{0}-1}-\tau_{% m_{0}-2})}italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c square-root start_ARG italic_K / caligraphic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F , italic_δ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG. So we can derive the requirement of the minimum prediction error at epoch m0subscript𝑚0m_{0}italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We need
