where ℰℱ,δ2⁢K2⁢(τm0−1−τm0−2)subscriptℰℱ𝛿2superscript𝐾2subscript𝜏subscript𝑚01subscript𝜏subscript𝑚02\mathcal{E}_{\mathcal{F},\frac{\delta}{2K^{2}}}(\tau_{m_{0}-1}-\tau_{m_{0}-2})caligraphic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F , divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is the prediction error with training sample size with n=τm−1−τm−2𝑛subscript𝜏𝑚1subscript𝜏𝑚2n=\tau_{m-1}-\tau_{m-2}italic_n = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which bounds the squared L2subscript𝐿2L_{2}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT distance between μ^^𝜇\widehat{\mu}over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG and μ𝜇\muitalic_μ on the test data sampled following the same data generation process as the training data. For the forth inequality, based on Corollary 1, we need the minimum sample size as 𝖭⁢(ϵ)=(σ2⁢d+1)⁢K3ϕ0⁢(Gt⁢(bt)+ϵ)2𝖭italic-ϵsuperscript𝜎2𝑑1superscript𝐾3subscriptitalic-ϕ0superscriptsubscript𝐺𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡italic-ϵ2\mathsf{N}(\epsilon)=\frac{(\sigma^{2}d+1)K^{3}}{\phi_{0}(G_{t}(b_{t})+% \epsilon)^{2}}sansserif_N ( italic_ϵ ) = divide start_ARG ( italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d + 1 ) italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_ϵ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG. We have τm=2msubscript𝜏𝑚superscript2𝑚\tau_{m}=2^{m}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, τm−1−τm−2=2m−1−2m−2=2m−2subscript𝜏𝑚1subscript𝜏𝑚2superscript2𝑚1superscript2𝑚2superscript2𝑚2\tau_{m-1}-\tau_{m-2}=2^{m-1}-2^{m-2}=2^{m-2}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. By the minimum sample size requirement for the cold start stage’s 𝖭⁢(ϵ)𝖭italic-ϵ\mathsf{N}(\epsilon)sansserif_N ( italic_ϵ ) for each arm, we know in exploitation stage, the starting epoch m0subscript𝑚0m_{0}italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT should be

𝖭𝖭\displaystyle\mathsf{N}sansserif_N ≤τm−1−τm−2,absentsubscript𝜏𝑚1subscript𝜏𝑚2\displaystyle\leq\tau_{m-1}-\tau_{m-2},≤ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (G.21)
log2⁡𝖭subscript2𝖭\displaystyle\log_{2}\mathsf{N}roman_log start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_N ≤m−2,absent𝑚2\displaystyle\leq m-2,≤ italic_m - 2 ,
m𝑚\displaystyle mitalic_m ≥m0=⌈2+log2⁡(σ2⁢d+1)⁢K3ϕ0⁢(τ𝒫∗+ϵ)2⌉.absentsubscript𝑚02subscript2superscript𝜎2𝑑1superscript𝐾3subscriptitalic-ϕ0superscriptsubscript𝜏subscript𝒫italic-ϵ2\displaystyle\geq m_{0}=\lceil 2+\log_{2}\frac{(\sigma^{2}d+1)K^{3}}{\phi_{0}(% \tau_{\mathcal{P}_{*}}+\epsilon)^{2}}\rceil.≥ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ⌈ 2 + roman_log start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG ( italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d + 1 ) italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_ϵ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ⌉ .

where τ𝒫∗subscript𝜏subscript𝒫\tau_{\mathcal{P}_{*}}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the minimum posterior mean gap based on Assumption 1. ∎

H Prediction Error of Ridge Regression with Random Design

From [66], we have the following lemmas of the prediction error of ridge regression with random design.

Lemma 1.

Assume the noise has gaussian distribution, then the excess risk bound is

𝔼⁢[∥β^−β∥Σ2]≤(1+R2λ⁢n)2⁢infβ∈ℝd{L⁢(β)+λ⁢∥β∥2−L⁢(β∗)}+(1+R2λ⁢n)⁢σ2⁢Tr⁢[(Σ+λ)−1⁢Σ]n𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥^𝛽𝛽Σ2superscript1superscript𝑅2𝜆𝑛2subscriptinfimum𝛽superscriptℝ𝑑𝐿𝛽𝜆superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝛽2𝐿superscript𝛽1superscript𝑅2𝜆𝑛superscript𝜎2Trdelimited-[]superscriptΣ𝜆1Σ𝑛\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\bigg{[}\left\lVert\widehat{\beta}-\beta\right\rVert_{% \Sigma}^{2}\bigg{]}\leq\bigg{(}1+\frac{R^{2}}{\lambda n}\bigg{)}^{2}\inf_{% \beta\in\mathbb{R}^{d}}\{L(\beta)+\lambda\left\lVert\beta\right\rVert^{2}-L(% \beta^{*})\}+\bigg{(}1+\frac{R^{2}}{\lambda n}\bigg{)}\frac{\sigma^{2}\text{Tr% }[(\Sigma+\lambda)^{-1}\Sigma]}{n}blackboard_E [ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG - italic_β ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Σ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ ( 1 + divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ italic_n end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_L ( italic_β ) + italic_λ ∥ italic_β ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L ( italic_β start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) } + ( 1 + divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ italic_n end_ARG ) divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Tr [ ( roman_Σ + italic_λ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Σ ] end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG (H.1)

where ∥X∥2≤Rsubscriptdelimited-∥∥𝑋2𝑅\left\lVert X\right\rVert_{2}\leq R∥ italic_X ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_R and risk L⁢(β)=𝔼⁢[(Y−⟨β,X⟩)2]𝐿𝛽𝔼delimited-[]superscript𝑌𝛽𝑋2L(\beta)=\mathbb{E}[(Y-\langle\beta,X\rangle)^{2}]italic_L ( italic_β ) = blackboard_E [ ( italic_Y - ⟨ italic_β , italic_X ⟩ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ].

Lemma 2.

For every λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0, we have

infβ∈ℝd{L⁢(β)+λ⁢∥β∥2−L⁢(β∗)}=λ⁢∥(Σ+λ)−1/2⁢Σ1/2⁢β∗∥2≤λ⁢∥β∗∥2.subscriptinfimum𝛽superscriptℝ𝑑𝐿𝛽𝜆superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝛽2𝐿superscript𝛽𝜆superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptΣ𝜆12superscriptΣ12superscript𝛽2𝜆superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝛽2\displaystyle\inf_{\beta\in\mathbb{R}^{d}}\{L(\beta)+\lambda\left\lVert\beta% \right\rVert^{2}-L(\beta^{*})\}=\lambda\left\lVert(\Sigma+\lambda)^{-1/2}% \Sigma^{1/2}\beta^{*}\right\rVert^{2}\leq\lambda\left\lVert\beta^{*}\right% \rVert^{2}.roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_β ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_L ( italic_β ) + italic_λ ∥ italic_β ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L ( italic_β start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) } = italic_λ ∥ ( roman_Σ + italic_λ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_β start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_λ ∥ italic_β start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (H.2)
Corollary 1.

The prediction error can be upper bounded bounded by

𝔼⁢[(β^𝖳⁢Xt−β𝖳⁢Xt)2]≤𝔼⁢[∥β^−β∥Σ2]⁢𝔼⁢[∥Xt∥Σ−12]≤R2λmin⁢(Σ)⁢𝔼⁢[∥β^−β∥Σ2]≤c3⁢σ2⁢dϕ0⁢n.𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsuperscript^𝛽𝖳subscript𝑋𝑡superscript𝛽𝖳subscript𝑋𝑡2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥^𝛽𝛽Σ2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝑋𝑡superscriptΣ12superscript𝑅2subscript𝜆Σ𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥^𝛽𝛽Σ2subscript𝑐3superscript𝜎2𝑑subscriptitalic-ϕ0𝑛\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\bigg{[}(\widehat{\beta}^{\sf T}X_{t}-\beta^{\sf T}X_{t% })^{2}\bigg{]}\leq\mathbb{E}\bigg{[}\left\lVert\widehat{\beta}-\beta\right% \rVert_{\Sigma}^{2}\bigg{]}\mathbb{E}\bigg{[}\left\lVert X_{t}\right\rVert_{% \Sigma^{-1}}^{2}\bigg{]}\leq\frac{R^{2}}{\lambda_{\min}(\Sigma)}\mathbb{E}% \bigg{[}\left\lVert\widehat{\beta}-\beta\right\rVert_{\Sigma}^{2}\bigg{]}\leq% \frac{c_{3}\sigma^{2}d}{\phi_{0}n}.blackboard_E [ ( over^ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sansserif_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_β start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sansserif_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ blackboard_E [ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG - italic_β ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Σ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_Σ ) end_ARG blackboard_E [ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG - italic_β ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Σ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ divide start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_ARG .
Proof.

By Lemma 1 and Lemma 2, we have

𝔼⁢[∥β^−β∥Σ2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥^𝛽𝛽Σ2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\bigg{[}\left\lVert\widehat{\beta}-\beta\right\rVert_{% \Sigma}^{2}\bigg{]}blackboard_E [ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG - italic_β ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Σ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤(1+R2λ⁢n)2⁢λ⁢∥β∗∥2+(1+R2λ⁢n)⁢σ2⁢dnabsentsuperscript1superscript𝑅2𝜆𝑛2𝜆superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝛽21superscript𝑅2𝜆𝑛superscript𝜎2𝑑𝑛\displaystyle\leq\bigg{(}1+\frac{R^{2}}{\lambda n}\bigg{)}^{2}\lambda\left% \lVert\beta^{*}\right\rVert^{2}+\bigg{(}1+\frac{R^{2}}{\lambda n}\bigg{)}\frac% {\sigma^{2}d}{n}≤ ( 1 + divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ italic_n end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ ∥ italic_β start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( 1 + divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ italic_n end_ARG ) divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG (H.3)
≤(1+1c1)2⁢c1n+(1+1c1)⁢σ2⁢dnabsentsuperscript11subscript𝑐12subscript𝑐1𝑛11subscript𝑐1superscript𝜎2𝑑𝑛\displaystyle\leq\bigg{(}1+\frac{1}{c_{1}}\bigg{)}^{2}\frac{c_{1}}{n}+\bigg{(}% 1+\frac{1}{c_{1}}\bigg{)}\frac{\sigma^{2}d}{n}≤ ( 1 + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG + ( 1 + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG

Assume that ∥β∥2≤1subscriptdelimited-∥∥𝛽21\left\lVert\beta\right\rVert_{2}\leq 1∥ italic_β ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ 1, R≤1𝑅1R\leq 1italic_R ≤ 1 and λ=c1n𝜆subscript𝑐1𝑛\lambda=\frac{c_{1}}{n}italic_λ = divide start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG. So when n≥N=1c12⁢(c2−1)2𝑛𝑁1superscriptsubscript𝑐12superscriptsubscript𝑐212n\geq N=\frac{1}{c_{1}^{2}(c_{2}-1)^{2}}italic_n ≥ italic_N = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG and denote c2=(1+1c1)2subscript𝑐2superscript11subscript𝑐12c_{2}=(1+\frac{1}{c_{1}})^{2}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 1 + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. So when n≥N𝑛𝑁n\geq Nitalic_n ≥ italic_N, we have

𝔼⁢[∥β^−β∥Σ2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥^𝛽𝛽Σ2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\bigg{[}\left\lVert\widehat{\beta}-\beta\right\rVert_{% \Sigma}^{2}\bigg{]}blackboard_E [ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG - italic_β ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Σ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤c1⁢c2n+c2⁢σ2⁢dnabsentsubscript𝑐1subscript𝑐2𝑛subscript𝑐2superscript𝜎2𝑑𝑛\displaystyle\leq\frac{c_{1}c_{2}}{n}+\frac{c_{2}\sigma^{2}d}{n}≤ divide start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG (H.4)
≤c1⁢c2+c2⁢σ2⁢dnabsentsubscript𝑐1subscript𝑐2subscript𝑐2superscript𝜎2𝑑𝑛\displaystyle\leq\frac{c_{1}c_{2}+c_{2}\sigma^{2}d}{n}≤ divide start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG
≤c3⁢σ2⁢dnabsentsubscript𝑐3superscript𝜎2𝑑𝑛\displaystyle\leq c_{3}\frac{\sigma^{2}d}{n}≤ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG

where we define c3⁢σ2⁢d=c1⁢c2+c2⁢σ2⁢dsubscript𝑐3superscript𝜎2𝑑subscript𝑐1subscript𝑐2subscript𝑐2superscript𝜎2𝑑c_{3}\sigma^{2}d=c_{1}c_{2}+c_{2}\sigma^{2}ditalic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d for c3>0subscript𝑐30c_{3}>0italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0. Since we know λmin⁢(Σ)≥ϕ0subscript𝜆Σsubscriptitalic-ϕ0\lambda_{\min}(\Sigma)\geq\phi_{0}italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_Σ ) ≥ italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so the prediction error can be upper bounded by

𝔼⁢[(β^𝖳⁢Xt−β𝖳⁢Xt)2]≤c3⁢σ2⁢dϕ0⁢n𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsuperscript^𝛽𝖳subscript𝑋𝑡superscript𝛽𝖳subscript𝑋𝑡2subscript𝑐3superscript𝜎2𝑑subscriptitalic-ϕ0𝑛\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\bigg{[}(\widehat{\beta}^{\sf T}X_{t}-\beta^{\sf T}X_{t% })^{2}\bigg{]}\leq\frac{c_{3}\sigma^{2}d}{\phi_{0}n}blackboard_E [ ( over^ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sansserif_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_β start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sansserif_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ divide start_ARG italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_ARG (H.5)

∎

I Proof of No Regret Learning

We first denote Ψ:=𝒜𝒳assignΨsuperscript𝒜𝒳\Psi:=\mathcal{A}^{\mathcal{X}}roman_Ψ := caligraphic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT as the universal policy space, which contains all possible policies. Here we assume that |𝒳|<∞𝒳|\mathcal{X}|<\infty| caligraphic_X | < ∞ but allows |𝒳|𝒳|\mathcal{X}|| caligraphic_X | to be arbitrarily large. Focusing on such a setting enables us to highlight important ideas and key insights without the need to invoke measure theoretic arguments, which are necessary for infinite/uncountable 𝒳𝒳\mathcal{X}caligraphic_X. At epoch m⁢(t)𝑚𝑡m(t)italic_m ( italic_t ), m=m⁢(t)𝑚𝑚𝑡m=m(t)italic_m = italic_m ( italic_t ) if t𝑡titalic_t is clear, and pt(⋅)=pm(⋅|xt)p_{t}(\cdot)=p_{m}(\cdot|x_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) = italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). We next analyze the following virtual process at round t𝑡titalic_t in epoch m⁢(t)𝑚𝑡m(t)italic_m ( italic_t ). Here we use a novel virtual probability distribution Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) to analyze the pt⁢(⋅)subscript𝑝𝑡⋅p_{t}(\cdot)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ )’s effect over the regret. There are three steps:

  1. 1.

    Algorithm samples πt∼Qm⁢(⋅)similar-tosubscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝑄𝑚⋅\pi_{t}\sim Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ), where πt:𝒳→𝒜:subscript𝜋𝑡→𝒳𝒜\pi_{t}:\mathcal{X}\rightarrow\mathcal{A}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : caligraphic_X → caligraphic_A is a deterministic policy, and Qm⁢(⋅):𝒜𝒳→Probability Measure:subscript𝑄𝑚⋅→superscript𝒜𝒳Probability MeasureQ_{m}(\cdot):\mathcal{A}^{\mathcal{X}}\rightarrow\text{Probability Measure}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) : caligraphic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → Probability Measure (a probability distribution over all policies in 𝒜𝒳superscript𝒜𝒳\mathcal{A}^{\mathcal{X}}caligraphic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT).

  2. 2.

    At time t𝑡titalic_t, xt∼𝒫Xsimilar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒫𝑋x_{t}\sim\mathcal{P}_{X}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

  3. 3.

    Algorithm selects at=πt⁢(xt)subscript𝑎𝑡subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡a_{t}=\pi_{t}(x_{t})italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

Note that at round t𝑡titalic_t, Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) is a stationary distribution which has already been determined at the beginning of epoch m𝑚mitalic_m. How to construct this Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ )? For any policy pm(⋅|⋅)p_{m}(\cdot|\cdot)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | ⋅ ), we can construct a unique product probability measure Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) on ΨΨ\Psiroman_Ψ such that Qm⁢(π)=∏x∈𝒫Xpm⁢(π⁢(x)|x)subscript𝑄𝑚𝜋subscriptproduct𝑥subscript𝒫𝑋subscript𝑝𝑚conditional𝜋𝑥𝑥Q_{m}(\pi)=\prod_{x\in\mathcal{P}_{X}}p_{m}(\pi(x)|x)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) = ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ( italic_x ) | italic_x ) for all π∈Ψ𝜋Ψ\pi\in\Psiitalic_π ∈ roman_Ψ. This product measure Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) ensures that for every

pm⁢(a|x)=∑π∈Ψ𝕀⁢{π⁢(x)=a}⁢Qm⁢(π⁢(x)).subscript𝑝𝑚conditional𝑎𝑥subscript𝜋Ψ𝕀𝜋𝑥𝑎subscript𝑄𝑚𝜋𝑥\displaystyle p_{m}(a|x)=\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}\mathbb{I}\{\pi(x)=a\}Q_{m}(\pi(x)).italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a | italic_x ) = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_I { italic_π ( italic_x ) = italic_a } italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ( italic_x ) ) . (I.1)

That is, for any arbitrary context x∈𝒳𝑥𝒳x\in\mathcal{X}italic_x ∈ caligraphic_X, the algorithm’s recommended action generated by pm(⋅|x)p_{m}(\cdot|x)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_x ) is probabilistically equivalent to the action generated by Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) through this virtual process. Since Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) is a dense distribution over all deterministic polices in the universal policy space, we refer to Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) as the “equivalent randomized policy" induced by pm(⋅|⋅)p_{m}(\cdot|\cdot)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | ⋅ ). Since pm(⋅|⋅)p_{m}(\cdot|\cdot)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | ⋅ ) is completed determined by γmsubscript𝛾𝑚\gamma_{m}italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and μ^msubscript^𝜇𝑚\widehat{\mu}_{m}over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we know that Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) is also completely determined by γmsubscript𝛾𝑚\gamma_{m}italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and μ^msubscript^𝜇𝑚\widehat{\mu}_{m}over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We emphasize that the exploitation stage does not actually compute Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ), but implicit maintains Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) through spread parameter γmsubscript𝛾𝑚\gamma_{m}italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and estimated posterior mean μ^msubscript^𝜇𝑚\widehat{\mu}_{m}over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so called virtual process. That is important, as even when 𝒳𝒳\mathcal{X}caligraphic_X is known to the learner, computing the product measure Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) requires Ω⁢(|𝒳|)Ω𝒳\Omega(|\mathcal{X}|)roman_Ω ( | caligraphic_X | ) computational cost which is intractable for large 𝒳𝒳\mathcal{X}caligraphic_X.

To get the regret upper bound, we need following notations. For any action selection kernel p𝑝pitalic_p and any policy π𝜋\piitalic_π, let’s define the following terms:

  1. 1.

    Reward Rt⁢(π)subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋R_{t}(\pi)italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ): defines the expected reward in the measure of μ𝜇\muitalic_μ if it follows the policy π𝜋\piitalic_π to select the action π⁢(xt)𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\pi(x_{t})italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) with respect to distribution 𝒫Xsubscript𝒫𝑋\mathcal{P}_{X}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT: Rt⁢(π)=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[μ⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))]subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡R_{t}(\pi)=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}[\mu(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}% ))]italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ]

  2. 2.

    Reward R^tsubscript^𝑅𝑡\widehat{R}_{t}over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT: defines the expected reward in the measure of empirical μ^m⁢(t)subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT if follows the policy π𝜋\piitalic_π to select the action π⁢(xt)𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\pi(x_{t})italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) with respect to distribution 𝒫Xsubscript𝒫𝑋\mathcal{P}_{X}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT: R^t⁢(π)=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))]subscript^𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\widehat{R}_{t}(\pi)=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}[\widehat{% \mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}))]over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ].

  3. 3.

    Regret Reg⁢(π)Reg𝜋\text{Reg}(\pi)Reg ( italic_π ): defines the expected regret in the measure of μ𝜇\muitalic_μ if it follows the policy π𝜋\piitalic_π to select the action π⁢(xt)𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\pi(x_{t})italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) with respect to distribution 𝒫Xsubscript𝒫𝑋\mathcal{P}_{X}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT: Reg⁢(π)=Rt⁢(πμ)−Rt⁢(π)Reg𝜋subscript𝑅𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋\text{Reg}(\pi)=R_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-R_{t}(\pi)Reg ( italic_π ) = italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ).

  4. 4.

    Regret Reg^t⁢(π)subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ): defines the expected regret in the measure of empirical μ^m⁢(t)subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT if it follow the policy π𝜋\piitalic_π to select the action π⁢(xt)𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\pi(x_{t})italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) with respect to distribution 𝒫Xsubscript𝒫𝑋\mathcal{P}_{X}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT: Reg^t⁢(π)=R^t⁢(πμ^m⁢(t))−R^t⁢(π)subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋subscript^𝑅𝑡subscript𝜋subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript^𝑅𝑡𝜋\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)=\widehat{R}_{t}(\pi_{\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}})-% \widehat{R}_{t}(\pi)over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ).

where πμ^m⁢(t)subscript𝜋subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡\pi_{\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the policy selects the action bt=argmaxi∈[K]μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,i)subscript𝑏𝑡subscriptargmax𝑖delimited-[]𝐾subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖b_{t}=\mathop{\mathrm{argmax}}_{i\in[K]}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},i)italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_argmax start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ) according to Eq. (6).

Besides, for any probability kernel pmsubscript𝑝𝑚p_{m}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and any policy π⁢(⋅)𝜋⋅\pi(\cdot)italic_π ( ⋅ ), let V⁢(pm,π)𝑉subscript𝑝𝑚𝜋V(p_{m},\pi)italic_V ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ) denote the expected inverse probability

V⁢(pm,π)=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[1pm⁢(π⁢(xt)|xt)]𝑉subscript𝑝𝑚𝜋subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]1subscript𝑝𝑚conditional𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡V(p_{m},\pi)=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\frac{1}{p% _{m}(\pi(x_{t})|x_{t})}\bigg{]}italic_V ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ] (I.2)

and define 𝒱t⁢(π)subscript𝒱𝑡𝜋\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi)caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) as the maximum expected inverse probability over the exploitation stage,

𝒱t⁢(π)=maxm0≤m≤m⁢(t)−1⁡V⁢(pm,π)subscript𝒱𝑡𝜋subscriptsubscript𝑚0𝑚𝑚𝑡1𝑉subscript𝑝𝑚𝜋\displaystyle\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi)=\max_{m_{0}\leq m\leq m(t)-1}{V(p_{m},\pi)}caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_m ≤ italic_m ( italic_t ) - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ) (I.3)

I.1 Key Lemmas

Lemma 3 (Azuma-Hoeffding Inequality).

Let {Dk,ℱk}k=1∞superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝐷𝑘subscriptℱ𝑘𝑘1\{D_{k},\mathcal{F}_{k}\}_{k=1}^{\infty}{ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be a martingale difference sequence for which there are constants {(ak,bk)}k=1nsuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑎𝑘subscript𝑏𝑘𝑘1𝑛\{(a_{k,b_{k}})\}_{k=1}^{n}{ ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, such that Dk∈[ak,bk]subscript𝐷𝑘delimited-[]subscript𝑎𝑘subscript𝑏𝑘D_{k}\in[a_{k,b_{k}}]italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] almost surely for all k=1,2,…,n𝑘12…𝑛k=1,2,...,nitalic_k = 1 , 2 , … , italic_n. Then, for all t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0, Pr⁡[|∑k=1nDk|≥t]≤2⁢exp⁡[−2⁢t2∑k=1n(bk−ak)2]Prsuperscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑛subscript𝐷𝑘𝑡22superscript𝑡2superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑘subscript𝑎𝑘2\Pr[|\sum_{k=1}^{n}D_{k}|\geq t]\leq 2\exp[-\frac{2t^{2}}{\sum_{k=1}^{n}(b_{k}% -a_{k})^{2}}]roman_Pr [ | ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≥ italic_t ] ≤ 2 roman_exp [ - divide start_ARG 2 italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ].

Lemma 4.

∀t∈[τm−1+1,τm]for-all𝑡subscript𝜏𝑚11subscript𝜏𝑚\forall t\in[\tau_{m-1}+1,\tau_{m}]∀ italic_t ∈ [ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], with probability at least 1−δ/2⁢m21𝛿2superscript𝑚21-\delta/2m^{2}1 - italic_δ / 2 italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we have

𝔼xt,at⁢[(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,at)−μ⁢(xt,at))2|\textfrak⁢St−1]≤ℰℱ,δ/(2⁢m2)⁢(τm−1−τm−2)=16⁢Kγm2subscript𝔼subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡delimited-[]conditionalsuperscriptsubscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡2\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡1subscriptℰℱ𝛿2superscript𝑚2subscript𝜏𝑚1subscript𝜏𝑚216𝐾subscriptsuperscript𝛾2𝑚\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{x_{t},a_{t}}\bigg{[}\big{(}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t}% ,a_{t})-\mu(x_{t},a_{t})\big{)}^{2}|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\bigg{]}\leq\mathcal{E}_% {\mathcal{F},\delta/(2m^{2})}(\tau_{m-1}-\tau_{m-2})=\frac{16K}{\gamma^{2}_{m}}blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ≤ caligraphic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F , italic_δ / ( 2 italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = divide start_ARG 16 italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG (I.4)

where τm=2msubscript𝜏𝑚superscript2𝑚\tau_{m}=2^{m}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Therefore, the following event Λ2subscriptΛ2\Lambda_{2}roman_Λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT holds with probability at least 1−δ/21𝛿21-\delta/21 - italic_δ / 2:

Λ2:={∀t≥τm0,𝔼xt,at⁢[(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,at)−μ⁢(xt,at))2|\textfrak⁢St−1]≤16⁢Kγm2}.assignsubscriptΛ2formulae-sequencefor-all𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚0subscript𝔼subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡delimited-[]conditionalsuperscriptsubscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡2\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡116𝐾subscriptsuperscript𝛾2𝑚\displaystyle\Lambda_{2}:=\bigg{\{}\forall t\geq\tau_{m_{0}},\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}% ,a_{t}}\bigg{[}\big{(}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},a_{t})-\mu(x_{t},a_{t})\big{)% }^{2}|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\bigg{]}\leq\frac{16K}{\gamma^{2}_{m}}\bigg{\}}.roman_Λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := { ∀ italic_t ≥ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ≤ divide start_ARG 16 italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG } . (I.5)
Proof.

Note that Algorithm 2 always collects (xt,at;yt⁢(at))subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡(x_{t},a_{t};y_{t}(a_{t}))( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) )-type data used for OffPos algorithm to conduct offline training, where (xt,yt)∼𝒟similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑦𝑡𝒟(x_{t},y_{t})\sim\mathcal{D}( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∼ caligraphic_D and at∼pm⁢(t)−1(⋅|xt)a_{t}\sim p_{m(t)-1}(\cdot|x_{t})italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) based on epoch m⁢(t)−1𝑚𝑡1m(t)-1italic_m ( italic_t ) - 1 collected data. Based on the prediction error of the OffPos algorithm provided in 2, we have ∀t∈[τm−1+1,τm]for-all𝑡subscript𝜏𝑚11subscript𝜏𝑚\forall t\in[\tau_{m-1}+1,\tau_{m}]∀ italic_t ∈ [ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ],

𝔼xt,at⁢[(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,at)−μ⁢(xt,at))2|\textfrak⁢St−1]subscript𝔼subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡delimited-[]conditionalsuperscriptsubscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡2\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡1\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{x_{t},a_{t}}\bigg{[}\big{(}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t}% ,a_{t})-\mu(x_{t},a_{t})\big{)}^{2}|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\bigg{]}blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] =𝔼xt∼𝒫X,at∼pm⁢(t)−1(⋅|xt)⁢[(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,at)−μ⁢(xt,at))2|pm⁢(t)−1]\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{P}_{X},a_{t}\sim p_{m(t)-1}(\cdot|% x_{t})}\bigg{[}\big{(}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},a_{t})-\mu(x_{t},a_{t})\big{)% }^{2}|p_{m(t)-1}\bigg{]}= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] (I.6)
≤ℰℱ,δ/(2⁢m2)⁢(τm−1+1−τm−2−1)=16⁢Kγm2,absentsubscriptℰℱ𝛿2superscript𝑚2subscript𝜏𝑚11subscript𝜏𝑚2116𝐾subscriptsuperscript𝛾2𝑚\displaystyle\leq\mathcal{E}_{\mathcal{F},\delta/(2m^{2})}(\tau_{m-1}+1-\tau_{% m-2}-1)=\frac{16K}{\gamma^{2}_{m}},≤ caligraphic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F , italic_δ / ( 2 italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 ) = divide start_ARG 16 italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ,

where last the inequality simply follows from Lemma 4.1 and Lemma 4.2 from [4]. ∎

As we mentioned in previous, a starting point of our proof of regret upper bound is to translate the action selection kernel pm(⋅|⋅)p_{m}(\cdot|\cdot)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | ⋅ ) into an equivalent distribution over policies Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ). The following lemma provides a justification of such translation by showing the existence of an equivalent Qm⁢(⋅)subscript𝑄𝑚⋅Q_{m}(\cdot)italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) for every pm(⋅|⋅)p_{m}(\cdot|\cdot)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | ⋅ ). Here we refer Lemma 3 from [79] in the following Lemma.

Lemma 5.

Fix any epoch m≥m0𝑚subscript𝑚0m\geq m_{0}italic_m ≥ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The action selection scheme pm(⋅|⋅)p_{m}(\cdot|\cdot)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | ⋅ ) is a valid probability kernel ℬ⁢(𝒜)×𝒳→[0,1]→ℬ𝒜𝒳01\mathcal{B}(\mathcal{A})\times\mathcal{X}\rightarrow[0,1]caligraphic_B ( caligraphic_A ) × caligraphic_X → [ 0 , 1 ] over epoch m𝑚mitalic_m. There exists a probability measure Qmsubscript𝑄𝑚Q_{m}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT on ΨΨ\Psiroman_Ψ such that

∀at∈𝒜,∀xt∈𝒳,pm⁢(at|xt)=∑π∈Ψ𝕀⁢{π⁢(xt)=at}⁢Qm⁢(π)formulae-sequencefor-allsubscript𝑎𝑡𝒜formulae-sequencefor-allsubscript𝑥𝑡𝒳subscript𝑝𝑚conditionalsubscript𝑎𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝜋Ψ𝕀𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡subscript𝑄𝑚𝜋\forall a_{t}\in\mathcal{A},\forall x_{t}\in\mathcal{X},p_{m}(a_{t}|x_{t})=% \sum_{\pi\in\Psi}\mathbb{I}\{\pi(x_{t})=a_{t}\}Q_{m}(\pi)∀ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_A , ∀ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_X , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_I { italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) (I.7)

The following Lemma demonstrates yt⁢(πμ)−yt⁢(at)−∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢Reg⁢(π)subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋Reg𝜋y_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-y_{t}(a_{t})-\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\text{Reg}(\pi)italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) Reg ( italic_π ) is a martingale difference sequence with respect to \textfrak⁢St\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡\textfrak{S}_{t}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Lemma 6.

Fix any epoch m≥m0∈ℕ𝑚subscript𝑚0ℕm\geq m_{0}\in\mathbb{N}italic_m ≥ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_N, for any round t𝑡titalic_t in epoch m𝑚mitalic_m, we have:

𝔼xt,yt,at⁢[yt⁢(πμ)−yt⁢(at)|\textfrak⁢St−1]=∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢Reg⁢(π)subscript𝔼subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡delimited-[]subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇conditionalsubscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡1subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋Reg𝜋\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{x_{t},y_{t},a_{t}}\bigg{[}y_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-y_{t}(a_{t% })|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\bigg{]}=\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\text{Reg}(\pi)blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) Reg ( italic_π ) (I.8)
Proof.

By the definition of 𝔼⁢[yt⁢(at)]𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\mathbb{E}[y_{t}(a_{t})]blackboard_E [ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ], we have

𝔼xt,yt,at⁢[yt⁢(πμ⁢(xt))−yt⁢(at)|\textfrak⁢St−1]subscript𝔼subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡delimited-[]subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡conditionalsubscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡1\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{x_{t},y_{t},a_{t}}\bigg{[}y_{t}(\pi_{\mu}(x_{t}))-y_{% t}(a_{t})|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\bigg{]}blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] (I.9)
=𝔼xt,at⁢[μ⁢(xt,πμ⁢(xt))−μ⁢(xt,at)|\textfrak⁢St−1]absentsubscript𝔼subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡conditional𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡1\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t},a_{t}}\bigg{[}\mu(x_{t},\pi_{\mu}(x_{t}))-\mu(% x_{t},a_{t})|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\bigg{]}= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]
=𝔼xt∼𝒫X,at∼pm⁢(t)(⋅|x)⁢[μ⁢(xt,πμ⁢(xt))−μ⁢(xt,at)]\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{P}_{X},a_{t}\sim p_{m(t)}(\cdot|x)% }\bigg{[}\mu(x_{t},\pi_{\mu}(x_{t}))-\mu(x_{t},a_{t})\bigg{]}= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_x ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[∑at∈𝒜pm⁢(t)⁢(at|xt)⁢(μ⁢(xt,πμ⁢(xt))−μ⁢(xt,at))]absentsubscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscriptsubscript𝑎𝑡𝒜subscript𝑝𝑚𝑡conditionalsubscript𝑎𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}\big{[}\sum_{a_{t% }\in\mathcal{A}}p_{m(t)}(a_{t}|x_{t})\bigg{(}\mu(x_{t},\pi_{\mu}(x_{t}))-\mu(x% _{t},a_{t})\bigg{)}\bigg{]}= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ]

By Lemma 5, we have

𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳[∑at∈𝒜pm⁢(t)(at|x)(μ(xt,πμ(xt))−μ(xt,at))\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\sum_{a_{t% }\in\mathcal{A}}p_{m(t)}(a_{t}|x)\bigg{(}\mu(x_{t},\pi_{\mu}(x_{t}))-\mu(x_{t}% ,a_{t})\bigg{)}blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x ) ( italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) (I.10)
=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[∑at∈𝒜∑π∈Ψ𝕀⁢{π⁢(xt)=at}⁢Qm⁢(π)⁢(μ⁢(xt,πμ⁢(xt))−μ⁢(xt,at))]absentsubscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscriptsubscript𝑎𝑡𝒜subscript𝜋Ψ𝕀𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡subscript𝑄𝑚𝜋𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\sum_{a_{% t}\in\mathcal{A}}\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}\mathbb{I}\{\pi(x_{t})=a_{t}\}Q_{m}(\pi)% \bigg{(}\mu(x_{t},\pi_{\mu}(x_{t}))-\mu(x_{t},a_{t})\bigg{)}\bigg{]}= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_I { italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ( italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ]
=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢(μ⁢(xt,πμ⁢(xt))−μ⁢(xt,π⁢(xt)))]absentsubscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\sum_{\pi% \in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\bigg{(}\mu(x_{t},\pi_{\mu}(x_{t}))-\mu(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}))% \bigg{)}\bigg{]}= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ( italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ) ]
=∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[μ⁢(xt,πμ⁢(xt))−μ⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))]absentsubscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\displaystyle=\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{% \mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\mu(x_{t},\pi_{\mu}(x_{t}))-\mu(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}))\bigg{]}= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ]
=∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢Reg⁢(π)absentsubscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋Reg𝜋\displaystyle=\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\text{Reg}(\pi)= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) Reg ( italic_π )

where the last equality is from the definition of the expected regret in the measure μ𝜇\muitalic_μ. ∎

Lemma 7.

Fix any epoch m≥m0∈ℕ𝑚subscript𝑚0ℕm\geq m_{0}\in\mathbb{N}italic_m ≥ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_N and any round t𝑡titalic_t in epoch m𝑚mitalic_m, we have:

∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢Reg^t⁢(π)<Kγm.subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)<\frac{K}% {\gamma_{m}}.∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) < divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG . (I.11)
Proof.

For any t𝑡titalic_t in epoch m𝑚mitalic_m, based on the definition of Reg^t⁢(π)=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,πμ^m⁢(t))−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))]subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝜋subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}[% \widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},\pi_{\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}})-\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_% {t},\pi(x_{t}))]over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ] where bt=πμ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt)=argmaxi∈[K]μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,i)subscript𝑏𝑡subscript𝜋subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscriptargmax𝑖delimited-[]𝐾subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝑖b_{t}=\pi_{\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}}(x_{t})=\mathop{\mathrm{argmax}}_{i\in[K]}% \widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},i)italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_argmax start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ), we have

∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢Reg^t⁢(π)subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋\displaystyle\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) (I.12)
=∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,bt)−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))]absentsubscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\displaystyle=\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{% \mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},b_{t})-\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_% {t},\pi(x_{t}))\bigg{]}= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ]
=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,bt)−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,π⁢(xt)))]absentsubscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\sum_{\pi% \in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\bigg{(}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},b_{t})-\widehat{\mu}_{m(t% )}(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}))\bigg{)}\bigg{]}= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ) ]
=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[∑at∈𝒜∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢𝕀⁢{π⁢(xt)=at}⁢(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,bt)−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,at))]absentsubscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscriptsubscript𝑎𝑡𝒜subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋𝕀𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\sum_{a_{% t}\in\mathcal{A}}\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\mathbb{I}\{\pi(x_{t})=a_{t}\}% \bigg{(}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},b_{t})-\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},a_{t})% \bigg{)}\bigg{]}= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) blackboard_I { italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ]
=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[∑at∈𝒜pm⁢(t)⁢(at|xt)⁢(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,bt)−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,at))]absentsubscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscriptsubscript𝑎𝑡𝒜subscript𝑝𝑚𝑡conditionalsubscript𝑎𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\sum_{a_{% t}\in\mathcal{A}}p_{m(t)}(a_{t}|x_{t})\bigg{(}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},b_{t}% )-\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},a_{t})\bigg{)}\bigg{]}= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ]

where the last inequality holds by the γm⁢(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,bt)−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,at))K+γm⁢(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,bt)−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,at))<1subscript𝛾𝑚subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡1\frac{\gamma_{m}(\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},b_{t})-\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},% a_{t}))}{K+\gamma_{m}(\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},b_{t})-\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x% _{t},a_{t}))}<1divide start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG < 1. ∎

The next lemma establishes the relationship between the predicted implicit regret and the true implicit regret of any policy at round t𝑡titalic_t. This lemma ensures that the predicted implicit regret of good polices are becoming more and more accurate, while the predicted implicit regret of bad policies do not need to have such property.

Lemma 8.

Suppose the event Λ2subscriptΛ2\Lambda_{2}roman_Λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in Lemma 4 holds, let C0=204subscript𝐶0204C_{0}=204italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 204. For all policies π𝜋\piitalic_π and epoch m≥m0𝑚subscript𝑚0m\geq m_{0}italic_m ≥ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have:

Reg⁢(π)Reg𝜋\displaystyle\text{Reg}(\pi)Reg ( italic_π ) ≤2⁢Reg^t⁢(π)+C0⁢Kγmabsent2subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\leq 2\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)+\frac{C_{0}K}{\gamma_{m}}≤ 2 over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) + divide start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG (I.13)
Reg^t⁢(π)subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋\displaystyle\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ≤2⁢Reg⁢(π)+C0⁢Kγmabsent2Reg𝜋subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\leq 2\text{Reg}(\pi)+\frac{C_{0}K}{\gamma_{m}}≤ 2 Reg ( italic_π ) + divide start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG

That is, for any policy, Lemma 8 bounds the prediction error of the implicit regret estimate.

Proof.

We prove it via induction on epoch m𝑚mitalic_m. We first consider the base case when m=1𝑚1m=1italic_m = 1 and 1≤t≤τ11𝑡subscript𝜏11\leq t\leq\tau_{1}1 ≤ italic_t ≤ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. In this case, since γ1=1subscript𝛾11\gamma_{1}=1italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, we know that ∀π∈Ψfor-all𝜋Ψ\forall\pi\in\Psi∀ italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ,Reg⁢(π)≤K≤C0⁢K/γ1Reg𝜋𝐾subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾1\text{Reg}(\pi)\leq\sqrt{K}\leq C_{0}K/\gamma_{1}Reg ( italic_π ) ≤ square-root start_ARG italic_K end_ARG ≤ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K / italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, Reg^t⁢(π)=0≤C0⁢K/γ1subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋0subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾1\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)=0\leq C_{0}K/\gamma_{1}over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) = 0 ≤ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K / italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Note that we use condition 𝔼x∼𝒫X⁢[supa,a′∈𝒜(μ⁢(x,a)−μ⁢(x,a′))]≤Ksubscript𝔼similar-to𝑥subscript𝒫𝑋delimited-[]subscriptsupremum𝑎superscript𝑎′𝒜𝜇𝑥𝑎𝜇𝑥superscript𝑎′𝐾\mathbb{E}_{x\sim\mathcal{P}_{X}}[\sup_{a,a^{\prime}\in\mathcal{A}}(\mu(x,a)-% \mu(x,a^{\prime}))]\leq\sqrt{K}blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∼ caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_μ ( italic_x , italic_a ) - italic_μ ( italic_x , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ] ≤ square-root start_ARG italic_K end_ARG, which is very weak - in the special case of multi-armed bandits, it means "the gap between mean rewards of two actions is no greater than K𝐾\sqrt{K}square-root start_ARG italic_K end_ARG. Thus the claim holds in the base case.

For the induction step, fix some epoch m>1𝑚1m>1italic_m > 1. We assume that for all epochs m′≤msuperscript𝑚′𝑚m^{\prime}\leq mitalic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_m, all rounds t′superscript𝑡′t^{\prime}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in epoch m′superscript𝑚′m^{\prime}italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and all π∈Ψ𝜋Ψ\pi\in\Psiitalic_π ∈ roman_Ψ,

Reg⁢(π)Reg𝜋\displaystyle\text{Reg}(\pi)Reg ( italic_π ) ≤2⁢Reg^t′⁢(π)+C0⁢Kγm′,absent2subscript^Regsuperscript𝑡′𝜋subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾superscript𝑚′\displaystyle\leq 2\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t^{\prime}}(\pi)+C_{0}\frac{K}{\gamma% _{m^{\prime}}},≤ 2 over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) + italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , (I.14)
Reg^t′⁢(π)subscript^Regsuperscript𝑡′𝜋\displaystyle\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t^{\prime}}(\pi)over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ≤2⁢Reg⁢(π)+C0⁢Kγm′.absent2Reg𝜋subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾superscript𝑚′\displaystyle\leq 2\text{Reg}(\pi)+C_{0}\frac{K}{\gamma_{m^{\prime}}}.≤ 2 Reg ( italic_π ) + italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG .

Step 1. For all rounds t𝑡titalic_t in epoch m𝑚mitalic_m and all π∈Ψ𝜋Ψ\pi\in\Psiitalic_π ∈ roman_Ψ, we first show that

Reg⁢(π)≤2⁢Reg^t⁢(π)+C0⁢Kγm.Reg𝜋2subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\text{Reg}(\pi)\leq 2\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)+C_{0}\frac{K}{% \gamma_{m}}.Reg ( italic_π ) ≤ 2 over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) + italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG .

Based on the definition of Reg⁢(π)Reg𝜋\text{Reg}(\pi)Reg ( italic_π ) and Reg^tsubscript^Reg𝑡\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have

Reg⁢(π)−Reg^t⁢(π)Reg𝜋subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋\displaystyle\text{Reg}(\pi)-\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)Reg ( italic_π ) - over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) =(Rt⁢(πμ)−Rt⁢(π))−(R^t⁢(πμ^m⁢(t))−R^t⁢(π))absentsubscript𝑅𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript^𝑅𝑡subscript𝜋subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript^𝑅𝑡𝜋\displaystyle=(R_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-R_{t}(\pi))-(\widehat{R}_{t}(\pi_{\widehat{\mu% }_{m(t)}})-\widehat{R}_{t}(\pi))= ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ) - ( over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ) (I.15)
≤(Rt⁢(πμ)−Rt⁢(π))−(R^t⁢(πμ)−R^t⁢(π))absentsubscript𝑅𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript^𝑅𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript^𝑅𝑡𝜋\displaystyle\leq(R_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-R_{t}(\pi))-(\widehat{R}_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-% \widehat{R}_{t}(\pi))≤ ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ) - ( over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) )
≤|R^t⁢(π)−Rt⁢(π)|+|Rt⁢(πμ)−R^t⁢(πμ)|absentsubscript^𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript𝑅𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript^𝑅𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇\displaystyle\leq|\widehat{R}_{t}(\pi)-R_{t}(\pi)|+|R_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-\widehat{% R}_{t}(\pi_{\mu})|≤ | over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) - italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) | + | italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) |
≤4⁢𝒱t⁢(π)⁢Kγm+4⁢𝒱t⁢(πμ)⁢Kγmabsent4subscript𝒱𝑡𝜋𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚4subscript𝒱𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\leq\frac{4\sqrt{\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi)}\sqrt{K}}{\gamma_{m}}+\frac% {4\sqrt{\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi_{\mu})}\sqrt{K}}{\gamma_{m}}≤ divide start_ARG 4 square-root start_ARG caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) end_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_K end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG 4 square-root start_ARG caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_K end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG
≤𝒱t⁢(π)5⁢γm+𝒱t⁢(πμ)5⁢γm+40⁢Kγmabsentsubscript𝒱𝑡𝜋5subscript𝛾𝑚subscript𝒱𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇5subscript𝛾𝑚40𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\leq\frac{\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi)}{5\gamma_{m}}+\frac{\mathcal{V}_{t% }(\pi_{\mu})}{5\gamma_{m}}+\frac{40K}{\gamma_{m}}≤ divide start_ARG caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG 40 italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG

where the third inequality holds by Lemma 9, and the last inequality holds by the AM-GM inequality. Based on the definition of 𝒱t⁢(π),𝒱t⁢(πμ)subscript𝒱𝑡𝜋subscript𝒱𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi),\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi_{\mu})caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) , caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and the upper bound of the expected inverse probability from Lemma 10, there exist epochs at least one i,j≤m𝑖𝑗𝑚i,j\leq mitalic_i , italic_j ≤ italic_m and t≤τm𝑡subscript𝜏𝑚t\leq\tau_{m}italic_t ≤ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that
