𝒱t⁢(π)5⁢γmsubscript𝒱𝑡𝜋5subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\frac{\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi)}{5\gamma_{m}}divide start_ARG caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ≤K+γi⁢Reg^τi⁢(π)5⁢γm≤K+γi⁢(2⁢Reg⁢(π)+C0⁢Kγi)5⁢γm≤(1+C0)⁢K5⁢γm+25⁢Reg⁢(π)absent𝐾subscript𝛾𝑖subscript^Regsubscript𝜏𝑖𝜋5subscript𝛾𝑚𝐾subscript𝛾𝑖2Reg𝜋subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾𝑖5subscript𝛾𝑚1subscript𝐶0𝐾5subscript𝛾𝑚25Reg𝜋\displaystyle\leq\frac{K+\gamma_{i}\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{\tau_{i}}(\pi)}{5% \gamma_{m}}\leq\frac{K+\gamma_{i}(2\text{Reg}(\pi)+C_{0}\frac{K}{\gamma_{i}})}% {5\gamma_{m}}\leq\frac{(1+C_{0})K}{5\gamma_{m}}+\frac{2}{5}\text{Reg}(\pi)≤ divide start_ARG italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 2 Reg ( italic_π ) + italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG ( 1 + italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_K end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 5 end_ARG Reg ( italic_π )
𝒱t⁢(πμ)5⁢γmsubscript𝒱𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇5subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\frac{\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi_{\mu})}{5\gamma_{m}}divide start_ARG caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ≤K+γj⁢Reg^τj⁢(πμ)5⁢γm≤K+γj⁢(2⁢Reg⁢(πμ)+C0⁢Kγj)5⁢γm=(1+C0)⁢K5⁢γmabsent𝐾subscript𝛾𝑗subscript^Regsubscript𝜏𝑗subscript𝜋𝜇5subscript𝛾𝑚𝐾subscript𝛾𝑗2Regsubscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾𝑗5subscript𝛾𝑚1subscript𝐶0𝐾5subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\leq\frac{K+\gamma_{j}\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{\tau_{j}}(\pi_{\mu})}% {5\gamma_{m}}\leq\frac{K+\gamma_{j}(2\text{Reg}(\pi_{\mu})+C_{0}\frac{K}{% \gamma_{j}})}{5\gamma_{m}}=\frac{(1+C_{0})K}{5\gamma_{m}}≤ divide start_ARG italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 2 Reg ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = divide start_ARG ( 1 + italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_K end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG

where the last equality by Reg⁢(πμ)=0Regsubscript𝜋𝜇0\text{Reg}(\pi_{\mu})=0Reg ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 0. Combining all above, we have

Reg⁢(π)−Reg^t⁢(π)≤25⁢Reg⁢(π)+2⁢(1+C0)⁢K5⁢γm+40⁢KγmReg𝜋subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋25Reg𝜋21subscript𝐶0𝐾5subscript𝛾𝑚40𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\text{Reg}(\pi)-\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)\leq\frac{2}{5}\text% {Reg}(\pi)+\frac{2(1+C_{0})K}{5\gamma_{m}}+\frac{40K}{\gamma_{m}}Reg ( italic_π ) - over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ≤ divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG 5 end_ARG Reg ( italic_π ) + divide start_ARG 2 ( 1 + italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_K end_ARG start_ARG 5 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG 40 italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG

which is equivalent to

Reg⁢(π)≤53⁢Reg^t⁢(π)+2⁢C0⁢K3⁢γm+68⁢Kγm≤2⁢Reg^t⁢(π)+C0⁢Kγm,Reg𝜋53subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋2subscript𝐶0𝐾3subscript𝛾𝑚68𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚2subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\text{Reg}(\pi)\leq\frac{5}{3}\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)+\frac% {2C_{0}K}{3\gamma_{m}}+\frac{68K}{\gamma_{m}}\leq 2\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(% \pi)+\frac{C_{0}K}{\gamma_{m}},Reg ( italic_π ) ≤ divide start_ARG 5 end_ARG start_ARG 3 end_ARG over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) + divide start_ARG 2 italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_ARG start_ARG 3 italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG 68 italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ≤ 2 over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) + divide start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ,

by C0≤204subscript𝐶0204C_{0}\leq 204italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ 204.

Step 2. We then show for all rounds t𝑡titalic_t in epoch m𝑚mitalic_m and all π∈Ψ𝜋Ψ\pi\in\Psiitalic_π ∈ roman_Ψ,

Reg^t⁢(π)≤2⁢Reg⁢(π)+C0⁢Kγm.subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋2Reg𝜋subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚\displaystyle\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)\leq 2\text{Reg}(\pi)+\frac{C_{0}K}{% \gamma_{m}}.over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ≤ 2 Reg ( italic_π ) + divide start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG . (I.16)

Similar to step 2, we can get the similar result. Thus we complete the inductive step, and the claim proves to be true for all m∈ℕ𝑚ℕm\in\mathbb{N}italic_m ∈ blackboard_N. ∎

This following lemma is a key step to provide the relationship of Reg^t⁢(π)subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) and Reg⁢(π)Reg𝜋\text{Reg}(\pi)Reg ( italic_π ) in Lemma 8.

Lemma 9.

For any round t≥τm0+1𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚01t\geq\tau_{m_{0}}+1italic_t ≥ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1, for any policy π∈Ψ𝜋Ψ\pi\in\Psiitalic_π ∈ roman_Ψ, we have

|R^t⁢(π)−Rt⁢(π)|≤4⁢𝒱t⁢(π)⁢Kγm⁢(t)subscript^𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋4subscript𝒱𝑡𝜋𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚𝑡|\widehat{R}_{t}(\pi)-R_{t}(\pi)|\leq\frac{4\sqrt{\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi)}\sqrt{K% }}{\gamma_{m(t)}}| over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) - italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) | ≤ divide start_ARG 4 square-root start_ARG caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) end_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_K end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG (I.17)
Proof.

Fix any policy π∈Ψ𝜋Ψ\pi\in\Psiitalic_π ∈ roman_Ψ, and any round t>τm0−1𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚01t>\tau_{m_{0}-1}italic_t > italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. By the definition of R^t⁢(π)subscript^𝑅𝑡𝜋\widehat{R}_{t}(\pi)over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) and Rt⁢(π)subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋R_{t}(\pi)italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ), we have

R^t⁢(π)−Rt⁢(π)=𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))−μ⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))]subscript^𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\displaystyle\widehat{R}_{t}(\pi)-R_{t}(\pi)=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_% {\mathcal{X}}}\bigg{[}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}))-\mu(x_{t},\pi(x_{% t}))\bigg{]}over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) - italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ] (I.18)

Given a context xtsubscript𝑥𝑡x_{t}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, define Δxt=μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))−μ⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))subscriptΔsubscript𝑥𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡𝜇subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\Delta_{x_{t}}=\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}))-\mu(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}))roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ), then we have the equality 𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[Δx]=R^t⁢(π)−Rt⁢(π)subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscriptΔ𝑥subscript^𝑅𝑡𝜋subscript𝑅𝑡𝜋\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}[\Delta_{x}]=\widehat{R}_{t}(% \pi)-R_{t}(\pi)blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) - italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ). For all s=τm0−1+1,…,τm⁢(t)−1𝑠subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011…subscript𝜏𝑚𝑡1s=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1,...,\tau_{m(t)-1}italic_s = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , … , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have

𝔼as|xs⁢[(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xs,as)−μ⁢(xs,as))2|\textfrak⁢St−1]subscript𝔼conditionalsubscript𝑎𝑠subscript𝑥𝑠delimited-[]conditionalsuperscriptsubscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑠subscript𝑎𝑠𝜇subscript𝑥𝑠subscript𝑎𝑠2\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡1\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{a_{s}|x_{s}}\bigg{[}\big{(}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{s}% ,a_{s})-\mu(x_{s},a_{s})\big{)}^{2}|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\bigg{]}blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_μ ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] (I.19)

≤4⁢𝒱t⁢(π)⁢Kγm⁢(t)absent4subscript𝒱𝑡𝜋𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚𝑡\displaystyle\leq\frac{4\sqrt{\mathcal{V}_{t}(\pi)}\sqrt{K}}{\gamma_{m(t)}}≤ divide start_ARG 4 square-root start_ARG caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) end_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_K end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG

where the last inequality holds by the definition of the exploitation rate of γm⁢(t)subscript𝛾𝑚𝑡\gamma_{m(t)}italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. ∎

The following Lemma is a key step to control the expected inverse probability V⁢(pm⁢(t),π)𝑉subscript𝑝𝑚𝑡𝜋V(p_{m(t)},\pi)italic_V ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ).

Lemma 10.

Fix any epoch m≥m0∈ℕ𝑚subscript𝑚0ℕm\geq m_{0}\in\mathbb{N}italic_m ≥ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_N, we have:

V⁢(pm⁢(t),π)≤K+γm⁢Reg^t⁢(π)𝑉subscript𝑝𝑚𝑡𝜋𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋\displaystyle V(p_{m(t)},\pi)\leq K+\gamma_{m}\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)italic_V ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ) ≤ italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) (I.23)
Proof.

For any policy π∈Ψ𝜋Ψ\pi\in\Psiitalic_π ∈ roman_Ψ, given any context xt∈𝒳subscript𝑥𝑡𝒳x_{t}\in\mathcal{X}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_X, we have

1pm⁢(t)⁢(π⁢(xt)|xt)⁢{=K+γm⁢(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,bt)−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))), if ⁢π⁢(xt)≠bt;≤11/K=K=K+γm⁢(μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,bt)−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))), if ⁢π⁢(xt)=bt.1subscript𝑝𝑚𝑡conditional𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡casesotherwiseformulae-sequenceabsent𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡 if 𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡otherwiseformulae-sequenceabsent11𝐾𝐾𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡 if 𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡\frac{1}{p_{m(t)}(\pi(x_{t})|x_{t})}\begin{cases}&=K+\gamma_{m}(\widehat{\mu}_% {m(t)}(x_{t},b_{t})-\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}))),\text{ if }\pi(x_{% t})\neq b_{t};\\ &\leq\frac{1}{1/K}=K=K+\gamma_{m}(\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},b_{t})-\widehat{% \mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}))),\text{ if }\pi(x_{t})=b_{t}.\end{cases}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG { start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ) , if italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≠ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 / italic_K end_ARG = italic_K = italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ) , if italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (I.24)

Based on the definition of the expected inverse probability in Eq.(I.2), we have

V⁢(pm⁢(t),π)𝑉subscript𝑝𝑚𝑡𝜋\displaystyle V(p_{m(t)},\pi)italic_V ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ) =𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[1pm⁢(t)⁢(π⁢(xt)|xt)]absentsubscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]1subscript𝑝𝑚𝑡conditional𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}[\frac{1}{p_{m(t)% }(\pi(x_{t})|x_{t})}]= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ] (I.25)
≤K+γm⁢𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢[μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,bt)−μ^m⁢(t)⁢(xt,π⁢(xt))]absent𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳delimited-[]subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡subscript𝑥𝑡𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡\displaystyle\leq K+\gamma_{m}\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}% \bigg{[}\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},b_{t})-\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}(x_{t},\pi(x_{t}% ))\bigg{]}≤ italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ]
=K+γm⁢Reg^t⁢(π),absent𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋\displaystyle=K+\gamma_{m}\widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi),= italic_K + italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) ,

where the inequality follows by the condition if π⁢(xt)=bt𝜋subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑏𝑡\pi(x_{t})=b_{t}italic_π ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the last equation is followed by the definition of the expected regret in the measure of empirical μ^m⁢(t)subscript^𝜇𝑚𝑡\widehat{\mu}_{m(t)}over^ start_ARG italic_μ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. ∎

The following lemma provides the key step to provide the regret upper bound.

Lemma 11.

For any T∈ℕ𝑇ℕT\in\mathbb{N}italic_T ∈ blackboard_N, wiht probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ , the expected regret of RCB after T𝑇Titalic_T rounds is at most τm0−1+206⁢K⁢∑t=τm0−1+1T1/γm⁢(t)+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2/δ)subscript𝜏subscript𝑚01206𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011𝑇1subscript𝛾𝑚𝑡8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\tau_{m_{0}-1}+206K\sum_{t=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1}^{T}1/\gamma_{m(t)}+\sqrt{8(T-\tau% _{m_{0}-1})\log(2/\delta)}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 206 italic_K ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( 2 / italic_δ ) end_ARG.

Proof.

For each round t≥τm0−1+1𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011t\geq\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1italic_t ≥ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1, define Mt:=yt⁢(πμ)−yt⁢(at)−∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢Reg⁢(π)assignsubscript𝑀𝑡subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋Reg𝜋M_{t}:=y_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-y_{t}(a_{t})-\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\text{Reg}(\pi)italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) Reg ( italic_π ) and Mtsubscript𝑀𝑡M_{t}italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a martingale difference sequence since 𝔼xt,yt,at⁢[Mt|\textfrak⁢St−1]=0subscript𝔼subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡delimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝑀𝑡\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡10\mathbb{E}_{x_{t},y_{t},a_{t}}\big{[}M_{t}|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\big{]}=0blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = 0 provided by Lemma 6. So we have

𝔼xt,yt,at⁢[yt⁢(πμ)−yt⁢(at)|\textfrak⁢St−1]=∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢Reg⁢(π),subscript𝔼subscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡delimited-[]subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇conditionalsubscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡1subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋Reg𝜋\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{x_{t},y_{t},a_{t}}\bigg{[}y_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-y_{t}(a_{t% })|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\bigg{]}=\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\text{Reg}(\pi),blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) Reg ( italic_π ) , (I.26)

Since |Mt|≤2subscript𝑀𝑡2|M_{t}|\leq 2| italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≤ 2 by yt∈[0,1]subscript𝑦𝑡01y_{t}\in[0,1]italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ [ 0 , 1 ], by the Azuma-Hoeffding’s inequality from Lemma 3,

∑t=τm0−1+1TMt≤8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)superscriptsubscript𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011𝑇subscript𝑀𝑡8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle\sum_{t=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1}^{T}M_{t}\leq\sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0}-1})% \log(\frac{2}{\delta})}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG (I.27)

with probability at least 1−δ/21𝛿21-\delta/21 - italic_δ / 2. By Lemma 4, we can upper bound the regret the with probability at least 1−δ/21𝛿21-\delta/21 - italic_δ / 2,

∑t=τm0−1+1T𝔼⁢[yt⁢(πμ)−yt⁢(at)|\textfrak⁢St−1]superscriptsubscript𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011𝑇𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇conditionalsubscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\textfraksubscript𝑆𝑡1\displaystyle\sum_{t=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1}^{T}\mathbb{E}\bigg{[}y_{t}(\pi_{\mu})-y% _{t}(a_{t})|\textfrak{S}_{t-1}\bigg{]}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] (I.28)
≤∑t=τm0−1+1T∑π∈ΨQm⁢(π)⁢Reg⁢(π)+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011𝑇subscript𝜋Ψsubscript𝑄𝑚𝜋Reg𝜋8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle\leq\sum_{t=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1}^{T}\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}Q_{m}(\pi)\text% {Reg}(\pi)+\sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0}-1})\log(\frac{2}{\delta})}≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) Reg ( italic_π ) + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG

=∑t=τm0−1+1T∑π∈Ψ[2⁢Qm⁢(π)⁢Reg^t⁢(π)+Qm⁢(π)⁢C0⁢Kγm]+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011𝑇subscript𝜋Ψdelimited-[]2subscript𝑄𝑚𝜋subscript^Reg𝑡𝜋subscript𝑄𝑚𝜋subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle=\sum_{t=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1}^{T}\sum_{\pi\in\Psi}[2Q_{m}(\pi)% \widehat{\text{Reg}}_{t}(\pi)+Q_{m}(\pi)\frac{C_{0}K}{\gamma_{m}}]+\sqrt{8(T-% \tau_{m_{0}-1})\log(\frac{2}{\delta})}= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ∈ roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ 2 italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) over^ start_ARG Reg end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) + italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π ) divide start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG
≤∑t=τm0−1+1T[2⁢Kγm+C0⁢Kγm]+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011𝑇delimited-[]2𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚subscript𝐶0𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle\leq\sum_{t=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1}^{T}[\frac{2K}{\gamma_{m}}+\frac{C_{% 0}K}{\gamma_{m}}]+\sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0}-1})\log(\frac{2}{\delta})}≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG 2 italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG
≤206⁢∑t=τm0−1+1TKγm⁢(t)+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absent206superscriptsubscript𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011𝑇𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚𝑡8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle\leq 206\sum_{t=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1}^{T}\frac{K}{\gamma_{m(t)}}+% \sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0}-1})\log(\frac{2}{\delta})}≤ 206 ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG

where the second inequality holds by Lemma 8 to control the implicit expected regret in π𝜋\piitalic_π and the third inequality holds by Lemma 7 controlling the empirical regret. ∎

I.2 Proof of Theorem 2

Proof.

By Lemma 11, with probability 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ, we have

∑t=1T𝔼xt∼𝒟𝒳⁢(yt⁢(πμ)−yt⁢(at))superscriptsubscript𝑡1𝑇subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝑥𝑡subscript𝒟𝒳subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝜋𝜇subscript𝑦𝑡subscript𝑎𝑡\displaystyle\sum_{t=1}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{x_{t}\sim\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{X}}}(y_{% t}(\pi_{\mu})-y_{t}(a_{t}))∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) (I.29)
≤τm0−1+∑t=τm0−1+1T206⁢Kγm⁢(t)+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absentsubscript𝜏subscript𝑚01superscriptsubscript𝑡subscript𝜏subscript𝑚011𝑇206𝐾subscript𝛾𝑚𝑡8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle\leq\tau_{m_{0}-1}+\sum_{t=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+1}^{T}\frac{206K}{% \gamma_{m(t)}}+\sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0}-1})\log(\frac{2}{\delta})}≤ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 206 italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG
≤τm0−1+52⁢∑m=m0m1K⁢ℰℱ⁢(τm−2,τm−1)⁢(τm−τm−1)+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ).absentsubscript𝜏subscript𝑚0152superscriptsubscript𝑚subscript𝑚0subscript𝑚1𝐾subscriptℰℱsubscript𝜏𝑚2subscript𝜏𝑚1subscript𝜏𝑚subscript𝜏𝑚18𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle\leq\tau_{m_{0}-1}+52\sum_{m=m_{0}}^{m_{1}}\sqrt{K\mathcal{E}_{% \mathcal{F}}(\tau_{m-2},\tau_{m-1})}(\tau_{m}-\tau_{m-1})+\sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0% }-1})\log(\frac{2}{\delta})}.≤ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 52 ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m = italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT square-root start_ARG italic_K caligraphic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG .

With the assumption that the prior distribution 𝒫0subscript𝒫0\mathcal{P}_{0}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is normal and the variance is increasing in order 𝒪⁢(t)𝒪𝑡\mathcal{O}(t)caligraphic_O ( italic_t ), by τm=2msubscript𝜏𝑚superscript2𝑚\tau_{m}=2^{m}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we have

=τm0−1+52⁢σ⁢K⁢d⁢∑m=m0m1𝒪⁢(12m−2)⁢2m−1+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absentsubscript𝜏subscript𝑚0152𝜎𝐾𝑑superscriptsubscript𝑚subscript𝑚0subscript𝑚1𝒪1superscript2𝑚2superscript2𝑚18𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+52\sigma\sqrt{Kd}\sum_{m=m_{0}}^{m_{1}}\mathcal{O% }(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2^{m-2}}})2^{m-1}+\sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0}-1})\log(\frac{2}{% \delta})}= italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 52 italic_σ square-root start_ARG italic_K italic_d end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m = italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_O ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG ) 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG (I.30)
=τm0−1+52⁢σ⁢K⁢d⁢∑m=m0m1𝒪⁢(2m)+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absentsubscript𝜏subscript𝑚0152𝜎𝐾𝑑superscriptsubscript𝑚subscript𝑚0subscript𝑚1𝒪superscript2𝑚8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle=\tau_{m_{0}-1}+52\sigma\sqrt{Kd}\sum_{m=m_{0}}^{m_{1}}\mathcal{O% }(\sqrt{2^{m}})+\sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0}-1})\log(\frac{2}{\delta})}= italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 52 italic_σ square-root start_ARG italic_K italic_d end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m = italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_O ( square-root start_ARG 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG
≤τm0−1+52⁢σ⁢K⁢d⁢∫m0log2⁡(T)2x2⁢𝑑x+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absentsubscript𝜏subscript𝑚0152𝜎𝐾𝑑superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑚0subscript2𝑇superscript2𝑥2differential-d𝑥8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle\leq\tau_{m_{0}-1}+52\sigma\sqrt{Kd}\int_{m_{0}}^{\log_{2}(T)}2^{% \frac{x}{2}}dx+\sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0}-1})\log(\frac{2}{\delta})}≤ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 52 italic_σ square-root start_ARG italic_K italic_d end_ARG ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d italic_x + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG
≤τm0−1+104ln⁡2⁢σ⁢K⁢d⁢T+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absentsubscript𝜏subscript𝑚011042𝜎𝐾𝑑𝑇8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle\leq\tau_{m_{0}-1}+\frac{104}{\ln{2}}\sigma\sqrt{KdT}+\sqrt{8(T-% \tau_{m_{0}-1})\log(\frac{2}{\delta})}≤ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 104 end_ARG start_ARG roman_ln 2 end_ARG italic_σ square-root start_ARG italic_K italic_d italic_T end_ARG + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG
<τm0−1+151⁢σ⁢K⁢d⁢T+8⁢(T−τm0−1)⁢log⁡(2δ)absentsubscript𝜏subscript𝑚01151𝜎𝐾𝑑𝑇8𝑇subscript𝜏subscript𝑚012𝛿\displaystyle<\tau_{m_{0}-1}+151\sigma\sqrt{KdT}+\sqrt{8(T-\tau_{m_{0}-1})\log% (\frac{2}{\delta})}< italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 151 italic_σ square-root start_ARG italic_K italic_d italic_T end_ARG + square-root start_ARG 8 ( italic_T - italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG

∎

J Additional Experiments Results

J.1 Additional Simulation Settings and Results Analysis

Setting 3 (ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ effects): We consider the RCB algorithm’s effect over different budget parameters with ϵ=[0.01,0.03,0.05]italic-ϵ0.010.030.05\epsilon=[0.01,0.03,0.05]italic_ϵ = [ 0.01 , 0.03 , 0.05 ] and prior variances Σi,0=1/λ⁢𝐈d=[1/3,1/5,1/10]⁢𝐈dsubscriptΣ𝑖01𝜆subscript𝐈𝑑1315110subscript𝐈𝑑\Sigma_{i,0}=1/\lambda{\bm{\mathbf{{I}}}}_{d}=[1/3,1/5,1/10]{\bm{\mathbf{{I}}}% }_{d}roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 / italic_λ bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ 1 / 3 , 1 / 5 , 1 / 10 ] bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. For rest parameters, T=5×104𝑇5superscript104T=5\times 10^{4}italic_T = 5 × 10 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, K=5𝐾5K=5italic_K = 5, d=5𝑑5d=5italic_d = 5, σ=0.05𝜎0.05\sigma=0.05italic_σ = 0.05, and βi,0=𝟎d,∀i∈[K]formulae-sequencesubscript𝛽𝑖0subscript0𝑑for-all𝑖delimited-[]𝐾\beta_{i,0}={\bm{\mathbf{{0}}}}_{d},\forall i\in[K]italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_0 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ∀ italic_i ∈ [ italic_K ].

Setting 4 (Prior Decay and Prior-Posterior Gap Assumption Mis-specification Effects): We also test the robustness of RCB algorithm when the Assumption 4 is mis-specified. Here we assume Σi,0=[0.02,0.04,0.1]⁢𝐈subscriptΣ𝑖00.020.040.1𝐈\Sigma_{i,0}=[0.02,0.04,0.1]{\bm{\mathbf{{I}}}}roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ 0.02 , 0.04 , 0.1 ] bold_I and the prior decay rate are linear decay, square root decay, and log decay. We set the environment parameters to be T=54,K=5,d=5formulae-sequence𝑇superscript54formulae-sequence𝐾5𝑑5T=5^{4},K=5,d=5italic_T = 5 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_K = 5 , italic_d = 5. We set ϵ=0.05italic-ϵ0.05\epsilon=0.05italic_ϵ = 0.05 and the prior mean β1,0=[1,1,1,1,1]𝖳subscript𝛽10superscript11111𝖳\beta_{1,0}=[1,1,1,1,1]^{\sf T}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ 1 , 1 , 1 , 1 , 1 ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sansserif_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and βi,0=[0,0,0,0,0]𝖳subscript𝛽𝑖0superscript00000𝖳\beta_{i,0}=[0,0,0,0,0]^{\sf T}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 , 0 ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT sansserif_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Setting 3 - ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ Effects Analysis:

In Figure 3, three columns represent different ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ’s effects over the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC gain and regret.

For the top of the figure, we found that RCB can satisfy the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC property under different ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ and λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ’s scenario. What’s more, all the instantaneous gains have the uplift trend (increasing gain), which shows similar pattern to the setting 1.

The bottom shows the relationship between the regret, ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ, and the prior variance Σi,0=1/λ⁢𝐈dsubscriptΣ𝑖01𝜆subscript𝐈𝑑\Sigma_{i,0}=1/\lambda{\bm{\mathbf{{I}}}}_{d}roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 / italic_λ bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We found that the regret of Σi,0=1/10⁢𝐈dsubscriptΣ𝑖0110subscript𝐈𝑑\Sigma_{i,0}=1/10{\bm{\mathbf{{I}}}}_{d}roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 / 10 bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is much larger than the regret of Σi,0=1/3⁢𝐈dsubscriptΣ𝑖013subscript𝐈𝑑\Sigma_{i,0}=1/3{\bm{\mathbf{{I}}}}_{d}roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 / 3 bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Σi,0=1/5⁢𝐈dsubscriptΣ𝑖015subscript𝐈𝑑\Sigma_{i,0}=1/5{\bm{\mathbf{{I}}}}_{d}roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 / 5 bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The reason is that in order to satisfy ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC property, the length of the cold start stage is linearly inverse proportion to the order of minimum eigenvalue ϕ0subscriptitalic-ϕ0\phi_{0}italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is demonstrated in Theorem 1. In other words, when the prior variance is small, it means that the customers have strong opinions over arms and the platform needs a long length of the cold start stage to make the RCB algorithm to satisfy the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC property. In addition, the regret will decreases when ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ increases. That is, when the platform wants to avoid long length of the cold start stage, it can sacrifice the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ to avoid a large regret, which is a trade-off between the guarantee of ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC property and the regret.

Setting 4 - Misspecified Effects Analysis:

In Figure 4, the three columns represent different prior margin τ𝒫0subscript𝜏subscript𝒫0\tau_{\mathcal{P}_{0}}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT’s effects over the regret and decay rate mis-specified over the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC gain. For top figure, we found RCB can still protect the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC under different ΣΣ\Sigmaroman_Σ scenario. Besides, we found that all the instantaneous ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC gains still have the uplift trend, which shows similar pattern to the setting 1 and setting 2. And the linear decay rate has the largest ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC gain and as Σi,0subscriptΣ𝑖0\Sigma_{i,0}roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT increases, the platform gains more.

The second row shows the relationship between the regret and margin, and the decay rate misspecified. We found that in any decay rate that the RCB algorithm employs, the regret of are really similar. The reason is that for any element of βi,0subscript𝛽𝑖0\beta_{i,0}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is small within [0,1]01[0,1][ 0 , 1 ] and the prior variance is moderate, three decay rates has similar effect. And we found that when variance increases, regret decrease. It indicates that when piror variance is large, the regret difference among three different decay rates is shrinkage. In other words, when costumers do not have strong opinions over arms (variance is large), different decay rates have similar regret effects.

J.2 Additional Real Data Analysis

Data Description:

This data contains the true patient-specific optimal warfarin doses (which are initially unknown but are eventually found through the physician-guided dose adjustment process over the course of a few weeks) for 5528 patients with more than 70 features. It also includes patient-level covariates such as clinical factors, demographic variables, and genetic information that have been found to be predictive of the optimal warfarin dosage [25]. We follow the similar data construction method in [13]. These covariates include:

  • •

    Demographics: gender, race, ethnicity, age, height (cm), weight (kg).

  • •

    Diagnosis: reason for treatment (e.g. deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, etc.).

  • •

    Pre-existing diagnoses: indicators for diabetes, congestive heart failure or cardiomyopathy, valve replacement, smoker status.

  • •

    Medications: indicators for potentially interacting drugs (aspirin, Tylenol, and Zocor).

  • •

    Genetics: presence of genotype variants of CYP2C9 and VKORC1.

The details can be found in Appendix 1 of [25]. All these covariates were hand-selected by professionals as being relevant to the task of warfarin dosing based on medical literature; there are no extraneously added variables. Since the detailed feature construction is not available in [13], we construct features follow the description in [13]. For diagnosis variables, we categorize the reason for treatment with 0/1 (1 represents patients have reason for treatment, 0 represents patients have no reason or unknown reason for treatment). For medications variables, we only include three medications: aspirin, Tylenol, Zocor, and all other medications are set to be 0. For genetics variables, we considered genotype variants of CYP2C9 and VKORC1 and the rest are set to be 0. The previous feature construction aims to avoid to high dimensional feature space. All categorical variables are transformed into dummy variables and all missing values are set to 0. After the data construction, we have 70 features and 5528 patients. In [13], they have 93 features, which is similar to our constructions.

Model Hyperparameter Setup: The prior mean’s setup follow the fixed-dose strategy and detailed explanation is provided in the following. We assume the prior variance increases linearly over time after the cold start. This allows physicians decease the confidence of their prior dose strategy and trust the RCB algorithm over time. In addition, the length of the cold start is determined by Theorem 1.

Addition Result Analysis.

Regret: In the first row, we show the regret of RCB with different confidence strengths (prior variance). When ΣΣ\Sigmaroman_Σ is small that means physicians have stronger opinion over the medium dosage, and the reverse is that the physicians have weaker opinion over the medium dosage. With different prior, we found that when Σ=0.4⁢𝐈Σ0.4𝐈\Sigma=0.4{\bm{\mathbf{{I}}}}roman_Σ = 0.4 bold_I, it has the largest regret since we need more samples in the cold start stage to let physicians trust RCB, which means that we need a large 𝖭𝖭\mathsf{N}sansserif_N. Interestingly, we found that when ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ increases (left to right), the regret difference between different prior variance shrinks because when we can tolerate with a higher ratio of non-ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC compatible patients, the prior’s effect decreases and the overall regret decreases because of a shorter cold start stage.

ϵ−DBICitalic-ϵDBIC\epsilon-\text{DBIC}italic_ϵ - DBIC Gain: In the second row, we show ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-DBIC gain of the RCB with different confidence strengths. Different prior variance has similar effect on the DBIC gain and all variants’ gain are above −ϵitalic-ϵ-\epsilon- italic_ϵ, which satisfies the property since the gain after the cold start stage is only determined by the posterior difference within the arm RCB selected.

K Nonlinear Reward Discussion

If the true model has a non-linear structure, we can approximate the nonlinear functions of the covariates by using basis expansion methods in from statistical learning [40].
